column5: I ve got a courier coming in morning  Saturday  from 7am. I ve no paperwork or returns label  do I need one or will the courier know it s going back to you as Tesco written on box? and what info do I need to include in box for you to issue refund? Had emailed you about this but no response.

Tried to order a replacement Tesco card. Some weeks later  2 separate envelopes of cards arrived  both with the wrong initial and with some details of the address incorrect. I speak clearly  slowly an without a strong accent. I rung the card people a couple of weeks ago and asked for a correctly made out replacement. It has yet to arrive. Hardly efficient.

My car wouldn t start tonight on the Tesco seacroft petrol forecourt. Although we got it sorted I just wanted to say how lovely the Tesco staff were. They offered me a cup of tea and a seat to wait for the AA to arrive. And once my car started one of the ladies offered to drive behind me to make sure I was safe! They all were lovely and very kind to me when I was in a panic. Thank you all very much x

Well tesco you have truly disappointed me this week. Have been a loyal customer for years and spend hundreds of pounds a month on online food shopping. Ordered my shopping on wed night to be delivered with the new saver delivery slot (6pm-10pm). Was due to arrive thursday night. 10pm and no shopping arrived....11pm and no shopping arrived. Husband Finally went to bed at 11.30pm as had work the next day. I called the helpline at 7am and was given no reason or explanation as to why my £255 food shop had not arrived. I was told it could no be guarenteed to be delivered today! I tried to cancel the order to be told would take 3-5 days to go back into my account. Not acceptable so i agreed to wait for a redelivery. Got £20 voucher when i asked for complaints department! I was on night shift... so got up at 5pm with a text to say will be delivered between 7-8pm. I left for work at 7.30pm and still no sign. Hubby called me and said it arrived at 20:15pm and 21 items are beyond use by date tomorrow and two are actually use by today!!!!!! Total cost £35!!! Oh and i got my £1 delivery refunded and a £5 gift card!!!!!! The driver apparently ran out of time!!! What a mess!!!! Any suggestions what i do with my £35 worth of food that needs eaten tomorrow?? Surely i should have been a priority to deliver on time today. Very disappointed Tesco :(

I would like to thank ben at tesco extra in bedworth for changing my tyer tonight. Its not in his job title but he still took the time to come and help two usless girls in our hour of need! Thankyou soo much ben you were a massive help on this cold wet night!

A big thank you to Abi at Tesco s Royston  Herts.  After watching my 3 year old try to escape the trolley she asked for his help with scanning my shopping to keep him occupied.  Also  thank you to the lady who bought the chocolates round.  I didn t catch your name but it let me get the last couple of aisles sorted before check out!  Great customer service.

Just came home from a late night shop. Staff were clearing out bread from bakery into pink coloured bags  can t remembered extract wording on them but basically stating not suitable for consumption??  Why is it that bread baked this morning  lunchtime or whenever today not suitable to be eaten tonight or tomorrow.  Am shocked. Someone going to bed tonight with an empty stomach will happily eat that tomorrow. I know I would cos I do. Why is it acceptable to only donate food that has long life. I am sure a shelter or another organisation that helps those in need wouldn t mind them  for sandwiches or breakfast tomorrow of dunk in a soup?Absolute waste. Am quite disgusted.
Can you clarify if the double the difference refund is ongoing and if it applies to tesco.com grocery orders please!

I m absolutely fuming ! Tesco direct are so unhelpful ! I ordered a ps4 500 gb after frantically trying to get one for an upcoming birthday and managed to pay for one online via the amazing deal.Too good to be true I asked myself. Maybe the gods were on my side! I paid online   had an order number and was collecting tomorrow . Then out of the blue this evening I receive an email saying item cancelled ??? In a panic I rang them . 19 minutes of my life I will never get back!!! 3 different   customer services managers later  each telling me to hold the line to be connected to a different dept   .(who is in charge of the managers that s what I want to know????? ) I get through to a rather unhelpful man . It s down to the website not updating stock . Then he blamed the suppliers. Then it was the website again. Really I replied most websites have a stock ordering system that states not in stock when it reaches zero. His reply was .well you would think so wouldn t you but the site is rubbish !!! I asked to go on the reserve list to which he replied they don t have one. Funny that as that is one of there options.... Then he said there s nothing more he could do ...  No help what so ever. I would like to know who is going to explain to the excited birthday boy that he s not getting his longed for gift ?????
I came in store today to be greater by an aisle of Christmas things and could only find Halloween costumes when will Halloween be arriving?

Very disappointed and hungry. Starting my weekend with empty fridge thanks to Tesco😠 My fridge and freezer items couldn t be delivered yesterday and were meant to be delivered today and refunded.  Today no delivery and no contact from Tesco and was just told on the phone that they have no record of such a situation.?! No duty manager available to resolve this for us and we now have to wait until tomorrow for investigation !? Think will be changing the retailer !!!!😠

So went into my local tesco store today with my fiancee to buy some cider I picked up the box of strongbow and a bottle of stiffys fruit salad cider I went to the self service check out and while scanning the items a member of staff approached me and asked me for id I handed my driving licence over to prove that I am 31 years old for the woman who was called Kathleen to then ask my 33 year old partner for id which she doesn t have with her to be told if she did not produce id I would not be served I said she isn t buying it I am it s my purchase I m paying for it so why should someone who has accompanied me to the shop provide id she replied  well ur not getting served  I said fine I ll drop her off and come back to be told she would tell everyone in store not to serve me I said fine I ll go else where she removed the strongbow from the checkout and then allowed me to purchase the bottle of stiffys cider how can a member of staff tell me I m not getting served alcohol allow me to continue with the transaction of a bottle of cider after her dictating that the law states about purchasing alcohol for under age people willingly or unwillingly break the law by allowing me to purchase alcohol after being refused service?  I spoke to a manager who wasn t helpful in anyway who also allowed me to then walk away with the cider after stating I will not be allowed to purchase alcohol   seriously tesco get a grip
Hey Tesco  why is everyone getting free organic boxes but me?

Well  Tesco Sheerness surpasses itself once again.   Rude  ignorant staff!!!   Hardly any tills open  lots of queues  so I join a queue only to have the till supervisor walk in front of me  shut the gate telling the cashier that she is now closed and totally blank me! Would it have cost her anything to mention to me that the till was being closed  or to close it after me  or even acknowledge that I was there!!  On the plus side  the finger that I caught in my trolley when I jumped back as she shut the gate in front of me  doesn t appear to be broken.
Never in my life have I had such bad customer service than I m getting at the moment from you I promise never to step foot in any of your stores or petrol stations again !!!!😡😡😡😡

I just went to tescos braintree as usual to buy cigarettes and found that they have altered the parking arrangements. It now appears that you can park free for 15minutes but if longer you must spend #5 on groceries  to be apply to park longer  as I sometimes go just for cigarettes it means that I must park walk to store  wait to be served and return to the car and exit within 15 minutes or there is a fine.  No thanks  I will buy them them elsewhere or pack up. Every little think helps

I m absolutely fuming ! Tesco direct are so unhelpful ! I ordered a ps4 500 gb after frantically trying to get one for an upcoming birthday and managed to pay for one online via the amazing deal.Too good to be true I asked myself. Maybe the gods were on my side! I paid online   had an order number and was collecting tomorrow . Then out of the blue this evening I receive an email saying item cancelled ??? In a panic I rang them . 19 minutes of my life I will never get back!!! 3 different   customer services managers later  each telling me to hold the line to be connected to a different dept   .(who is in charge of the managers that s what I want to know????? ) I get through to a rather obnoxious and unhelpful manager . It s down to the website not updating stock . Then he blamed the suppliers. Then it was the website again. Really I replied most websites have a stock ordering system that states not in stock when it reaches zero. His reply was .well you would think so wouldn t you but the site is rubbish !!! I asked to go on the reserve list to which he replied they don t have one. Funny that as that is one of there options.... Then he said there s nothing more he could do ...  No help what so ever. I would like to know who is going to explain to the excited birthday boy that he s not getting his longed for gift ?????
how can you warrant the price of using tyre air machine at tesco garage baldock going up from 20 pence to 50 pence in one week when sainsbury is still free

How the Andover store has any click and collect customers left I do not know  2 weeks 2 orders  twice not ready!!! I can t even begin to document the comedy of errors I encountered again this week!!!!! Poor Ryan at collection is doing a sterling job  poor lad had multiple customers and he handled it so well  your dot.com management team needs a kick up the backside! Should give Ryan the job!!!!

Hi there  I ve booked for a flexi saver delivery slot today from 1900-2300. I was told that a text would be sent to me this morning telling me which timeslot will I be assigned. That text  however  just arrived at 17:18 and said my delivery slot would be  1900-2000  I couldn t get back home by then considered the travel time required  may you please contact the driver for me telling him to come from 2030 onwards  or to leave the things at my front door? Many Thanks
can I ask whether Tesco sells cosmetics in china?

What a surprise Tesco won t fix my Hudl citing that it s not a manufacturing fault  despite the fact that I have read endless comments from people saying they have had exactly the same problem......🤔🤔 And no I don t wish to pay £59 to have it fixed would rather put the money towards a decent tablet thank you very much. I will never  EVER  buy another Hudl again.

Hi  I would just like to say how impressed I was with my delivery driver Yvonne from Scunthorpe Extra Store  she delivered my groceries last Tuesday morning  she was very cheerful and full of energy   it was raining and I passed a remark about just hanging out my bath towel  and she said I will fetch it in for you  and she did while I took my shopping out the trays  she then helped me unpack what was left in the trays. She is a very caring  helpful member of the Scunthorpe Team and worthy of a BIG THANKYOU.

I d like to say a massive thank you to the staff of you re Liverpool park road store. While visiting there today my grandfather s gold ring fell off my necklace  and I only realized upon returning home. However a member of staff had found said ring and was waiting for me to return after I had called. The ring as is  is nothing special but has a massive sentimental value to me as we lost him a while ago   and this is one of the few items I have to remember him by.  I do t know what I would of done if I lost it   so much love and any many thanks x
Northampton merewy no quark for two weeks. Whats happened? Is there a national quark shortage.

Thanks Tesco bank travel money service for causing issues with my holiday money collection at Tesco wokingham. T&Cs say collect from 2pm  and you choose this time to go for lunch for an hour!! I am now at the airport without any money because I couldn t wait for your return and no other staff member or manager could apparently help as it wasn t  Tesco  run  even though it clearly said Tesco bank travel bureau. Not happy.  I ll be seeking a full refund!!

Worst company I have had the displeasure of dealing with. I ve had to chase them 6 times for an order that is 6 days later than it should have been only to be told now it won t be delivered today it will be tomorrow. So now I have to waste another day and doors waiting on something I should have got last week!!!!! Never again

Please have a word with your delivery drivers in doncaster as they are clearly ignoring me. The next time 1 of them blocks my drive I will not be held responsible for my actions. It is an offence to park on a dropped kerb never mind blocking access to my property
Hi I was wondering wether you could help me out? X

Tesco staff are generally polite unlike other shops I could mention. At least you ask for customers views so aim to improve customer service if it s lacking unlike other frozen food shops. The vouchers are good too as a reward and way of saying thanks for shopping with you. It s good to be appreciated!

Not massively happy shopping due between 1&2 as this was the ONLY slot for today early. Text to say delivery delayed so now expect between 2&230. It s 230 no shopping and I leave for the school run in a matter of minutes. I m presuming your driver will be waiting for me to arrive back from the school run. This is the second time my delivery has been late with Tesco. I left Asda for this very reason - it would appear that I will looking elsewhere for my shopping if this isn t sorted!

Thank you Tesco Harford Bridge for looking after me & my 1yr old when I became unwell in your click & collect bay last Friday lunch time.  Staff were fantastic & I cannot commend them enough. Ensured I was comfortable whilst waiting for the ambulance to arrive and cuddled and fed my little boy (Sonny does not wait for food!!)  Our family were very touched by the card  flowers and good wishes we received upon returning home from hospital.  We cannot thank you enough  you were amazing 😊
Please check your inbox as I have sent a message
Tesco have 199 of my money and are doing nothing about it. Shall I ring up and scream down the phone or will you get this sorted?
See my earlier post. Do I have to come down and scream and shout to be heard???

Not impressed! Bought myself duck sushi this morning at Ravenside Store Bexhill on Sea for my lunch to find it went out of date yesterday. Therefore I have not had any lunch. Been on your website and completed a compliant form...havent had a reply.

What an insurance rip off!  Last year my  pet insurance was £295  the renewal has just come through as £458  that s over a 55% increase and the girl on the phone said it was something to do with new customer discount and booking it on line means you get it cheaper and did I want her to look at it for me?  The answer was  no thanks .  Oh and in case you are wondering  no I have not claimed on it at all!
4 attempts to get a self scan handset as the scanner wouldn t read my card. Then when I got a handset it wouldn t scan anything....Tesco Extra  Wellington. You lost my custom today...

Does anybody else on here use Tesco Loves Baby nappies? We ve always used them for our two and found them to be really good but the last 2 packets we have bought  seem to have a problem with the crystals. In that however full (or not full should I say) the nappies are seem to be leaking crystals out.  Has anyone else noticed a change? Or have I just had a duff batch? 😳
Tesco for future reference...Oat and raisin cookies is not a good substitute for Red velvet cookies..😮
Still waiting @Tesco. You sent a £200 Xbox One S god knows where. If I have to go in-store about this tomorrow  it won t be pretty. See my earlier post about 8.30am!

I went into my local store to get my little girl some knee length socks as on Tuesday  the rails were almost empty seem to be a trend of 1 pack per rail. what was there was summer ankle socks or multi coloured i went back last night and it remained the same rails with 1 pair of sock on. I did go in there the previous  week for wellies too and they had none i always go Tesco first as local and easy but you seem to be serious neglecting  your clothing department in Ely store whats the point of offering a clothing section if it is. Not going to be serviced i think socks is a pretty basic thing! Unfortunately i didn t have my phone on me both time to take any pictures. Luckily enough sainsbury around the corner were able to assist.

Would just like to thank your delivery driver at 10.30am this morning on Abbots road in Shrewsbury decided to swerve in front of me up the curb then break and then chose to indicate. Oh and then gave me a vile mouthful when I asked what the hell was he doing. Much appreciated especially when I ve got a 7month old in the back of my car and drive careful enough as it is to avoid wreckless idiots 😒

Absolute joke been sat in 3 days now waiting for a preorder game fifa what a joke phoned to say its still not arrived to have them say it could be upto monday. Why is this when its a preorder. Fuming.
I ha some clubcard boost days out vouchers which expired at the end of august.  We forgot to use them so does that mean that money has gone?

Will not be ordering from tesco again food dosnt turn up at right time never have all items take extra money from my account for things not on my list then take weeks to send your refund very bad costumer service I do all my shopping at tesco but now will be going to asda
I get that you want your staff to be friendly - but I m writing this whilst waiting for the cashier to stop gossiping 😡

I think it s time to stop shopping at Elmers End. I ve driven here especially to buy Warburton s farmhouse bread but the shelf is bare. There is no one to help  as it s not their department so they don t know. I ve just heard someone in the other aisle say  no wonder Tesco is going downhill . It s very frustrating to come to buy specific items in what is a massive store to find empty shelves.

I ordered an Xbox one bundle with FIFA 17 and plants v Zombie s a few days ago  the money has left my account however I have no emails of confirmation or delivery emails  nothing at all. Very concerned now  I have messaged this page and tried calling your customer service but no answer.

Got really looked after by staff in Tesco yesterday  when a lady brought me an umbrella when I was feeding Milo outside the store in the rain  it was lovely and dry when I started. When it started to rain heavily I got invited to come and sit on a seat in a quite corner of the store. Thank you tesco lady  I really appreciated it. Never thought I would be able to say I have breastfed in the freezer section in Tesco.
OMG.   Tesco home delivery. Don t bother complete mess from start now can get my money back for a week.   Never again.  Back to Asda it is then.

In tesco metro yesterday evening  long queue only 3 tills and one of 3 self serve tills open  got to the front  two tills close to cash up and the final self serve till breaks down. Asked a member of staff if they realised they only had 1 till open and got told very rudely  so  what s your problem . Charming! Is this what I should expect from tesco from now on!
FAO @Tesco  Xbox One S 4CX87HHGM. Delivery address Wilmslow. You ve delivered to Middleton? WTF? Get it back! Today! Want free games as compensation!!

Please can you tell me why after many years of buying Warburton seeded batch large loaf.. Tesco has decided to stop selling it? I can buy the small loaf but I don t want a small loaf. I can buy it in every other supermarket but yours and when I go to other supermarkets in end up buying my shopping from there which loses you money and loyalty. I hope you can answer this question.

Not sure that Tesco next day click and collect works. I ordered a PS4 at midnight on the 29th  still awaiting dispatch. I ordered a PS4 controller at 4.30pm on the 29th which was dispatched this morning for collection tomorrow. So it looks like I will have a controller which is late and no console to play it on. I can t say that I m excited by this prospect.

Felt I had to write on here about my delivery driver last night firstly he was 15 minutes early which wasn t too much of an issue but I d only just got home. He didn t say hello or anything when I answered the door. He didn t offer to help with the shopping. I have a 2 year old daughter who loves it when tesco deliver as she loves to say hello to the drivers. Normally the drivers say hello and interact with my daughter. The driver last night completely ignored her calling out  hello tesco man  from our lounge repeatedly. He didn t even smile or look at her. I felt this was extremely rude and left my daughter confused as to why he hadn t said hello back. Lastly  he didn t have the little computer for me to sign as it was charging in his van. He said he would sign it for me!! I do not want anyone else signing something on my behalf. Now I know it s only for my shopping but that s not the point. I asked if he had some paper I could sign which he got out of his pocket along with a pen. Now his next action really left me feeling insulted - before he took the pen back he took a used tissue from his pocket in order to take the pen from me like he didn t want to to7ch something I had touched. Just felt rude to me. Overall really not impressed with the driver last night!

I ordered 2 items to be delivered to store but only 1 has turned up where s the other?? Had no email saying it s out of stock or that it will be delayed yet you have taken the money for it! Can t seem to get through on the helpline and your workers instore are pretty much useless 😡

I have been trying since around the 2nd week of August to order 2 cardigans for my daughter for school. Tesco is the only place I can order with the the school logo as the local uniform shop only supply jumpers. We re this joy the case I d have long since given up as its pretty hopeless 😩 I ve even made phone calls to try and establish when stock would be available  and even suggested that Tesco takes some stock from elsewhere - I can order the exact same cardigan without school embroidery no problem at all! I find it astonishing that such a well established company like Tesco is unable to fulfill a simple supply and demand issue. For almost 7 weeks now you ve not had stock of the one item my daughter requires for school (in the correct size). It s abhorrent
Why all your pork chops are unavailable? Was something dodgy discovered?
Hello Tesco We are a small charity based in Oldham. We operate a food hub and frequently run out of reusable  bags for life . Could we count on you to provide us with a regular supply?

Hi Tesco  just want to give a massive shout out to one of your superb lorry drivers tonight who came to the rescue and help me and my girlfriend whose car broke down just of the road just outside of Basingstoke. Out of the many fast drivers going past  he was the only person who came and helped us by pushing our car to the side of the road and offering all the support we could. I didn t catch his name or his lorry number but what a fantastic man he was. Again  I must say you have some fantastic staff members working for you and he further proved that to us tonight. Hats off to you sir and hopefully you will be praised as highly as you deserve! Now to find out who you are😉 many thanks!
My sister pre oredered fifa 17 for me and i haven t received it on release day so im not impressed with your service and whats the point of pre ordering if u cant deliver on time

Evening. Would just like to say I was disappointed to find only the 28th September dates on your Cravendale Skimmed Milk at your Market Street  Manchester store tonight. The poor member of staff was embarrassed and went to see if you had any in date milk for me but didn t. Please keep an eye on the sell by dates for future reference.
Since the refurbishment in Borehamwood. Food is in the wrong ailses or wrong labelling.  Chaos
Can you tell me why your Haverfordwest store refused to sell me a scratchcard because I asked my grandaughter which one to buy

Thanks Tesco for have called 1 Hour later my scheduled delivery to tell me that your driver is sick.!!! what s the problem are just 9 pm and I was waiting for you and I am only gluten allergic..  100 out of 10 for Customer Service!!

Thanks Tesco for have called 1 Hour later my scheduled delivery to tell me that your driver is sick.!!! what s the problem are just 9 pm and I was waiting for you and I am only gluten allergic..  100 out of 10 for Customer Service!!

I would just like to let you know about the customer service i recieved today in your Brislington Callington Road store. I went in to the electrical desk to ask if they had any PS4 consoles left at the reduced price. 1 man didnt even bother looking up just said  no  Ok fair enough he may of been asked that question lots of times today but abit of eye contact and more than a 1 word answer would of been nice. The other member of staff asked if it was the 500 or 1TB I was after  to which i said i really didnt mind my sons would be happy with either. Instead of saying sorry  we dont have any he replied with  ive took the last 1  its waiting out the back for me for when i finish  with a smug look on his face. If he would of just said no i would of been fine with that  fair enough ive missed out. I went to the customer service desk on the way out just to mention the absolutely disgusting customer service i recieved  Tavon listened to what i had to say then called a manager. Whilst waiting he asked if I would still like to purchase 1 if he checked the system to see what was left. Whilst waiting he dealt with another customer who had also come to complain about the same members of staff I had! Throughout the whole time he was dealing with us he was polite  smiling and went above and beyond to help sort the problem out. I got my sons their PS4 & i hope Tavon gets some recognition for his excellent customer service.

Hello Tesco   I d like to make you aware of an incident in your Parkgrove Edinburgh store yesterday.  I paid for my groceries (£7.10) using my credit card  it showed as accepted on the card machine and then flashed up  accepted  on the till computer screen so I started to walk off.  I happened to turn back round and noticed the checkout assistant looked a bit confused so I asked if everything was ok and she said that the system had frozen and no receipt had come out and that she would get her manager.  So along he comes and tells me that despite my payment being accepted  I d have to wait around 10 mins for him to check his back office system for the payment.  I explained that I was in a hurry and that I would leave my number and should there be any issues I would pop back in later and pay again.  Unfortunately this was a bit too straight forward and drama-free for him so he told me I would have to leave my purchases if I were to leave the shop.  Considering my payment had been accepted  I was not willing to leave behind what I had paid for and proceeded to leave the shop.  The male manager and another female member of staff then followed me out to my car trying to get my purchases off of me.  They were taking down my car registration details to call the police about my  theft  of Ryvita  bananas  ham  Philadelphia and Snackajacks at which point I again offered them my name  address and telephone number so they could contact me if there was indeed an issue but they didn t want this  only my registration number so they could call the police  which he started to do before I drove off.  Unsurprisingly  the police haven t been in touch about this trivial matter!    I am deeply disappointed in the treatment I received from the staff in this store (mainly the manager)  in no way was I trying to thieve my Ryvitas etc  in fact it was the store manager trying to steal lunch off of a very evidently pregnant woman!!  The payment hasn t shown up yet on my statement so if indeed the computer freeze caused the payment not to be processed then please do let me know and I will settle my debt ASAP!    Regards   Melanie Shanks

Sorry but haven t shopped at Tesco for ages. Have moved twice since using online service. I want to buy something but won t accept current address only previous twice removed address.....sort it or I go elsewhere (club card however got sent to my current address on automatic renewal)

Really  Tesco?! On Tue 27.09  was viciously attacked by Store manager (Andrew?) and his tatto-ed ally at Strood  for my kid having picked 2 apples and 2 mandarine (?) from FREE FRUITS STAND  both smallish sizes.  Branded me a thief repeatedly (!!!)  Pack with fruits was snatched (!!!) from my daughter s lap (she sat in the shopping trolley  small one  eating apple  after school)  Prior this - was hunted around shop(!!!) while (I) have not got a clue about  action  .They instigated other workers  lie in my face by saying staff  reported on me  (when I confronted  staff  they had not clue about it) When I confronted him about lie- he just turned back and left. I am sure his desire to  act  fuelled by my nationality. Investigation should be carried and appropriate action taken; logically- mirrored action of SM s misconduct- OVERREACT and BE BULLY  and UNDERMINE  and BELITTLE  HUNT him DOWN  INSTIGATE OTHERS  be UNFAIR.  Surely  DO NOT LISTEN anything coming from him- just TALK OVER him all over again with same phrases. During all time he will try to say something - just wear some lousy smile  mansplaining one. And all of this- in presents of their children  ideally- the one s  who cannot understand the situation but got so stressed that will cry all the way home and did not sleep well. You really have explanations to do  Tesco.
Is there any way to find out if my local store (Alfreton) will be stocking the new Alpro ice cream? It is a bigger store but we have not found any there yet. :-(

I bought one of your meal deals for 10 squiddily diddillys (main side pudding drink) was planning a romantic night in with the enemy   We had pork shoulder in cider sauce  peas with leek and pancetta and a chocolate melt pudding with 2 bottles of beer.  I thought I was onto a right winner...... The pork was so tough I chewed it so long I nearly blew bubbles with it. The pea leek and pancetta had one piece of 1cm leek (which naturally I gave to the enemy as it was a romantic evening) I followed the instructions on the choc melt pudding and it tasted stale. The bottles of beer did however slide down a treat.  Do you think I m going to get lucky tonight?.... Absolute not!!!! Disappointed :-(
Just wondering of there are any plans to bring back normal jeans? Everywhere I look for my daughter it s skinny jeans only.

I m not sure if it s just an incentive at my local tesco but I would like to say what a brilliant idea I think the free piece of fruit is! My little girl loved having a satsuma to eat on the way round today and saved me having to do the usual taking an empty punnet or something to pay for at the till as this is what usually happens. Great idea tesco

Really fed up of paying your prices for Cravendale and no matter how often or when I buy it from your store in armada way Plymouth it s either off or short dated and taste more like your £1 4 pint milk! If I m lucky !  Please can you send me a link of where to complain  Thank you
Very sad to find your lemon loaf cake seems to be smaller.  We make it last usually but it s too small now....
I have just got back from visiting my local Tesco store and I have grease all over my Leggins from the basket I was carrying what do I do about this

So bad Tesco!! Ordered Fifa 17 which was supposed to be delivered by Royal Mail when in fact with a courier and still waiting! Have 3 frustrated kids as the other kids in the street are playing on theirs!!

Absolutely joke. Ordered your sandwich and sushi platter for this Saturday for my daughter s first birthday party. I ordered it on either Sunday or Monday (you state you need 2days notice  which we have given you)  Added some shopping onto the order tonight and when checking out it says that the platters aren t available until Sunday!! What am I supposed to do for food now?? Everywhere needs notice and wanted it delivered Saturday as we have no fridge space and I wanted to make it easy for us on her day!! Please can someone get back to me about this.

I have just received my order of polo tops through your uniform embroidery service and they are very damp   they smell funny to. Could you point me in the right direction to complain please. I really don t understand how they could be wet?

Big thank you to your Sudbury store  in particular Karen and Heather  for their kindness when helping my mother Vera Gormley over the last few weeks. Great examples of Tesco providing excellent customer service. She is so very grateful 👍

Tesco   I don t often write posts of gratitude and have never had much of a reason to write a post of praise for a supermarket before.  However  I would love to express my gratitude and take a moment to praise both Peter Mitchell and Alex McKenzie of the Tesco Direct Customer Services Team.  Peter has been helping me over the past three weeks and Alex has helped me tonight and I am in amazement due to them going out of their way to help  doing above and beyond what their job entails them to do and just being lovely.  It was my daughter s Birthday a few weeks ago and the one thing she asked for was the Club Petz Lucy Interactive doll. Not cheap for what it is at £40 but Tesco had it reduced at £24. I bought it back in May or June ready for September.  On opening it for her Birthday  I then went to set it up for her to find it wasn t working. Assuming it was faulty  I sent an email to Tesco explaining I d had it for a few months but it had only just been opened and Peter emailed me back offering me a refund or a replacement. Being a much wanted toy  I went for a replacement and a new Lucy arrived the next day.  Again  unfortunately  Lucy didn t work  and so I replied again and Peter got back to me. He offered me  as before  a replacement or a refund if I d lost confidence in the toy  and I chose to give Lucy one more shot  and the next day Lucy #3 arrived.  As expected  but whilst trying to be optimistic  Lucy didn t work. I emailed again but asked this time if I could have a refund so that my little girl could buy something else with the money.  Before  my emails had been saved for Peter to reply to but this time Alex replied.  He explained that he had processed my refund and that  as usual  it would take 3-5 days to go into my account.  He also told me that he had sent my daughter a  little gift  due to Lucy not having worked  and included the catalogue number in case I wanted to have a look.  That  little gift  was a large Disney Princess doll and tea party set which costs pretty much the same much as Lucy did at £40 rrp  now £20 on sale.  To say I am surprised as it was so unexpected is an understatement.  I am so grateful and I know my daughter is going to be so amazed and love her so  so much.  As well as all of that  both Peter and Alex have wished my little one a Happy Birthday and Alex has asked how she is after I apologised for a delay in emailing due to her being unwell.  They both have gone above and beyond to help me and I have never had such a helpful and happy outcome to an unfortunate issue before.  Well done Peter and Alex.  Your work hasn t gone unnoticed or unappreciated.  X

Dear Sir/Madam. As Mayor of Rhuddlan Town  North Wales. I am holding a Mayoral masquerade charity ball on 12th November 2016. I am hoping to hold a raffle on the night of my event  the proceeds going to LUKE’S FUND. Luke Davies  is 14 years old  born and bred in Rhuddlan  where his family live. On new years eve this year  Luke suffered a spinal stroke  which is very rare in adults  but virtually unheard of in children  which has left him paralysed from the neck down. I would be very grateful if you could donate a prize    the better the prize the more money we can hopefully raise  which would also be fantastic publicity for your company. Thanking you in anticipation.  Town Councillor Sara-Jane King Mayor of Rhuddlan

Hi I recently experienced a late delivery Monday just gone i have had a late delivery before. but always with either a text or phone call  this time nothing.  my slot was booked for 5-6. I run an after school club so everything has to run on time. My manager called me at 18.10 to tell me Tesco hasn t arrived  i came back to the club to let my staff go home as i was now paying them over time for the  lateness. I called Tesco and waited 10 min before an answer. still at this time I had heard nothing from either the driver or Tesco about the delay. Once Tesco had answered my call i had a lovely lady on the other side of the phone. She called the driver   who replied he was running late and couldn t see how far down i was on the list! she said the driver estimated he d be 10 min. this is at 18.40. I mentioned to the lady  on the phone it had to be by 6 50 as a yoga class was about to be set up. the driver asked the call assistant where to go once at the school. i heard the conversation and explained to pass school and go to the field. I waited and waited. the yoga class arrived  my meeting was about to start in the next village  and  i hadn t been home to see my children. I went out to the school road at 19 07 to see if i could see the Tesco van  I saw the Van and the driver. he had disturbed the school who to were having a meeting  Obversely  not listening to the directions given. He followed me to where i had told him originally to go. He then continued to be loud while unloading the shopping. the yoga class was trying to have a class! So My shopping arrived late  no info about the delay. I missed my meeting my 15 minutes. i didn t see my children and I had to pay my staff for over time! Is this right. is this how you d like to be spoken about? I have emailed Tesco and thePperson who relpied to me offered my £5 evoucher. I m sorry but the whole inconvenience cost me a lot more then that. I am a very appointed customer     .

I want to say a MASSIVE thank you to the two ladies in Tesco Havant petrol station  one named Kelly (didnt catch the other ladies name.)  My 3 year old son threw up in my car this morning as I was getting petrol.  I ran in to the shop to pay and buy some wipes. The ladies gave me blue roll to help clean up and while I was sorting him out Kelly came and put cones around my car and told me to take my time helping him. She came back out again a minute later with carrier bags  more blue roll and a drink of water for my little boy. She chatted and reassured him while I wiped up my car quickly. The other lady then came out with more carrier bags and offered to help sort out the rubbish.  They both made a stressful situation much easier for me and my little one and I wanted to thank them again. Not many people would go out of their way like they did and we both really appreciated it. Thank you Kelly and colleague xxx

Oh my -  how could Tesco Braintree  Town Centre store get it soooo wrong!! Today you ve implemented a car parking system to prevent people  abusing  the free parking facility  I don t object to that  but the system you ve brought in  is to say the least CRAZY!! To get free parking you now have to get an extra receipt when paying for your items (£5 minimum spend) then after exiting the store you have to find the machines located outside in the rain/hail/snow/sleet/wind  to firstly enter the last 3 digits of your car reg then find & select the image of your vehicle amongst at least 8 that are shown on the screen  then the extra receipt received at the checkout has to be scanned  but of course that doesn t work  so you have to fudge around to find reading glasses to manually enter the code  all of this while trying to hold a bag of shopping that you ve just bought & don t want to put down on the wet ground as its a hessian reusable bag!!! This is just my story of a visit to Tesco today and what it will be like from now on with winter almost upon us  for mums with screaming children & a trolley full of shopping it certainly isn t going to be fun!! I ve spoken to Julie Ashcrof duty manager  since I returned home but she couldn t give any real reason as to why most importantly the machines are located externally  other than an outside company is responsible for the setup . Come on you re going to tell me Mr Tesco had no input in this. Tesco you ve failed miserably in implementing something that could & should have been so simple - have some sense & have a rethiink. For me it s out of town shopping for my groceries now!!

I had a delivery due today and booked it between 10 & 2. I was given a delivery slot of between 11&12. So far  so good. Had a missed call at around 11.30 when I was seeing to my son so I called back and there was no answer. Around 12.45  I called Tesco to see where it was and my delivery was the last on a route and had been returned! There wasn t a knock at the door or anything so I wasn t happy. They said I would be called back within an hour. So i didn t seem too pushy I left it an hour and half before I phoned back. I was passed through to someone at the Bradford store (which was unprofessionally done because the man thought he was still speaking to customer services). He had just come on shift and nothing had been done about my order. He asked me to leave it with him and he would call me back within 10 minutes  he had to check the routes and see if anyone could get my shopping delivered to me. 3 minutes later  he called and said he had someone to deliver my shopping and they would be doing so in half an hour (usual time it takes to get from Bradford to my home). Half an hour later  my shopping turned up so a massive thank you to James from the Bradford store and the delivery driver who picked up the job (sorry  I didn t get your name) You turned a negative experience (first one from tesco) into a positive one and deserve a big pat on the back!

Good morning Tesco people  I am currently a delivery saver customer and pay £69 per year to have my shopping delivered. Until just recently this was a service that I thought was really good value for money.  My shopping gets picked and delivered from the Kingston store in Milton Keynes and recently the service has been really unacceptable.  I usually buy 5 days worth of meals and other household items per order. Often there is lots of  fresh meat  fruit  vegetables and various chilled items.  The issue recently has been the shelf life of my ordered items. At best there is usually 1 item that is  use by  the date of delivery and at worst there has been 5 items  use by  date of delivery. The delivery drivers inform me that this should never happen and if there is a short shelf life  it should be highlighted on the receipt to give you the option of sending it back. This is not happening. With pretty much every order over the last 10 weeks I have had to ring up to complain and then get a refund. I then have to go to a Tesco shop to replace the items which takes up my time and uses fuel. I have already paid £69 to have my shopping delivered so this really isn t proving very cost effective. The customer service department on the telephone have been very good. Refunding me for the items and emailing the Kingston store with my feedback. They have even requested (several times) that my shopping be audited to stop this happening. It hasn t worked  in fact it has got worse. The home delivery manager from Kingston did  telephone me to arrange redelivery of some food and when I asked her why my shopping wasn t being audited  she replied  well it will be now!  and told me she had to go.  My shopping clearly isn t being audited and to honest I am pretty fed up with the Kingston stores attitude. I would like this matter to be looked into further as I think the problems aren t just with the pickers  clearly the managers need some feedback too and policies need to be changed. I will not be renewing my delivery saver package this year and would in fact like my fee for the last 12 months refunded.  Also I will no longer be shopping with Tesco which means I won t buy food  fuel  clothes  anything from Tesco direct and we will be transferring the balance from our Tesco credit card to another provider. There has been more than enough opportunity to get things right but it simply hasn t happened for whatever reason and I do not feel valued as a loyal customer. It appears to me that once you have my money the customer service can go out of the window! I have posted this complaint today on social media as I want to be listened to and the complaint to be actioned. Hope to hear from you soon Kind regards  Sheryl

Absolutely shocking service. I had arranged for my shopping to be delivered between 7-11pm tonight. My husband received a text to say they would deliver between 9 and 10pm. At 9.41 a missed call from the driver as they were unable to find the property (even though I had written very clear instructions on the order on how to find the property and other drivers had never had a problem)! At 9.44 we call the number back. No answer. When we phone tesco at 10.01 we are told the driver attempted to deliver and had to take our delivery back to the store. So in the space of 3 mins after calling us the driver had returned to the store. I find this very hard to believe! Reality is we were blatantly the drivers last delivery. They couldn t be bothered to find the property and when we didn t answer the call thought  I ve attempted to deliver so end of my shift!   Absolutely ridiculous. The worst part of it all the fact that my twin babies now do not have the milk they need. Will not be using tesco ever again!

I am utterly shocked and disgusted that this is happening  I could not believe no one would understand what I was saying and even worse than that I had members of staff turn their backs on me. Extremely shocked at Tesco and their workers. 😡  I hope the staff are disciplined and trained  if they can t be respectful make them work away from customers. Not good ebough

It took an hour and 40 mins to get out of Tesco Borehamwood car park today. As the queues down parking aisles merge onto the main exit road  the  delight  that was the car park attendant gave precedence to the first parking aisle  whilst signal to the main exit road queue to wait. There were a further 3 parking aisles full of queued cars waiting to merge onto the main exit road  meaning that if you were in one of these queues (like I was) your wait was far longer than that of the first aisle. I watched that first aisle empty 3 times while stationary waiting to exit! When I was finally on the main exit road  I was signaled to wait again by this attendant  so I questioned him and advised that I d been waiting at this point for an hour and half and that his  help  was causing prolonged waiting times for the queues down the aisles further back in the car park. I was then told to  Go home and just be happy I m doing my job!    Totally unacceptable! Rude  useless staff -

Posting on behalf of a friend  Well..Crazy shopping trip to Tesco Old Swan. I went with Sam and he climbed in the trolley. No room for shopping like  but who cares as he is happy. Walked in the store and  Dear me  The noise was winding me up. I could see Sam was getting agitated  but I went with it hoping he would calm. A few items were bought before I noticed Sam changing. I stopped the trolley and tried to calm him but it was too late. The meltdown had started.The Colli-flower went flying through the air and I just managed to save the breadstick. Then  the high pitched scream came. That earth shattering scream that breaks your heart. Breaks my heart  but not the silly cow nosing at the cheese in the aisle. Oh no!! She felt the need to face us and shout very load  for f*cks sake . I asked her if the scream had effected her ears and her reply was  Yes actually  it did . Then it was my turn  Good!! Now you may have a small understanding what this guy is going through. He hears everything 20  30 40 times more than me and you. He is hearing all kinds in here and it has caused this meltdown. Not that an idiot like you is going to understand or care about an upset child as you are to interested in your selfish ears.       With that I heard clapping. Turning around I saw a man and women applauding and saying  Well said lad . The woman trotted of head down and ashamed. The couple offered to walk around and help me get my shopping. also said they would pack everything at the till for me. I refused their offer but thanked them for it. At the till Sam was still upset and a few tuts were given his way. These were solved by me glaring at those doing it. I will not just take Sam out of the store  I cuddle him and help him through it. Then we loaded the shopping and the lady on the till began her magic. She told the customers  This will take as long as this little boy needs  so I suggest you move to another till if you are in a hurry . Then she refused to allow me to pack a bag  and let Sam play with the card machine that he was interested in. She was wonderful and helped calm Sam down by allowing him all the time he needed. Her name was Toni  and I gave feedback about her great service to her manager...... Shopping is never boring with our kids.  Big well done to Toni  #AutismAwareness #DifferentNotLess

I wasnt happy about this and asked for a refund  the member of staff walked away  and another member of staff came up and asked us what was wrong  we told them we had been given cold food  they shook there head at us  and then said do you still want the toast  we replied no  after a few minutes we were given our money back  no explanation as to why our order was served cold  or why it would take so long to cook replacements  we did get a  Sorry about that  as we were leaving. Well Sorry to say tescos we will not be visting your Cafe again  poor customer service and even worse food !

2 hrs ·   I was in Tesco ara damansara  Malaysia on 22/9/16 at around 2 pm with my sister to do some groceries shopping. We park our car in the car park near the entrance to Tesco.  My sister open her car booth for me to put the groceries in n was looking for her keys to open the door when she notice a proton satria light metallic brown coming to a stop near us. A young Malay boy got out of the car and came straight to my sister to snatch her handbag. She was screaming n I took the trolley next to me to push at the guy. His friend drove the car next to us n open the door for him. He drag my sister on the floor until the bag came off. They took off n we look around for the security officer for help. When the guy came in white uniform he just listen n call another Indian guy who told us to check out the cctv camera which was just a few feet away from us. My sister went to the office but could not view it. They told my sister that they just saw us pushing the trolley n opening the car booth to put things in but can t see the proton car n the snatch thieve incident 😬 The people in Tesco was of no help non did they take any responsibility for the incident that happen inside the car park. We have to run around to go to the security office n then customer service counter to write a report. No assistance was given to us. It seem like a daily incident n nobody was interested in what happen to us. Lucky for us my sister was not hurt but the incident was quite traumatic to have your bag snatch in broad daylight.  I hope Tesco Ara damansara will take responsibility to beef up security in their car park n be more people friendly when incidents like that happens to their customers.  They did not render any help to us except to listen and walk away.  We will not be going to Tesco to do our shopping any more.  Tesco should take more responsibility to ensure the safety of their customers.

Like to make a complaint made a click and collect order to pick up today 271314216 had no confirmation about it being ready to pick up rang customer services waited on hold for 15 mins to then be put on hold again  while someone spoke to a  .com manager  and was told there was an issue made with the order might as well have said it was our fault it was at the preswich store not the salford store as selected wouldn t be transfered across no changing store had to get it from there or nothing this store is 8 miles from my house I live near salford store 3 mins to get there now have to get my kids and arrange a lift to go down the motorway it s a good job I didn t just go to the salford store as was going to would have been a waiste of mine and my kids time attitude on phone was wonderfully off putting couldn t speak and then was asked if the only option I was given was ok. What is going on ?

I ordered some shopping to be delivered Friday night when it came half of it was someone s else s and half was missing   I had to go through everything I had bought and check it off at the door   after giving the driver back the other items which were not mine including a birthday cake and party food none of the rest of mine was even on the van  she told me the label had fallen off and I would have to ring you for the £15 worth of shopping I ve paid for and not received   well I have rung and I can t get through and I have emailed and had no response I want the rest of my shopping then I will never use tesco online again   it completely defeats the point in online shopping and skipping out the annoying people.

Can you pass this on to the right people in your product development team please? I have a complaint regarding your own brand size 5 pull up nappies. so I had to reshuffle my tesco food shop delivery that was ment to be delivered yesterday  as my 6 month old baby was rushed into intensive care unit  and they  they accidentally refunded me instead of rearranging my delivery for today as they agreed when I called    but I got a call for the store  and they said they will still deliver it tonight on them as it was their error   £80 food shop for free  feeling a lil emotional  I cried on the phone and told them how much that means to me especially with a sick baby in hospital  and my baby is making progress this morning   Thankyou tesco  every little very much does help 😢😢

This morning i woke up and quite fancied one of your yummy choc chip digestive biscuits. I came down the stairs  and opened the packet of biscuits  took a couple out. i have to hide them from my 19month old as she not allowed them  so 2 are hidden quite well i can eat them discreetly and avoid her saying  bic bic mine .... I come to sit down and eat them  i put just a tiny bit of biscuit in my mouth and realised it was soggy!!  It couldnt of been my 19month old or 4yr old that some how got a sneaky dribbly nibble of the biscuit as im very much used to! ... i even thought maybe the dog had a cheeky lick as i walked from kitchen to living room as shes quite known for pinching a biscuit or two... wasnt her either she was snoring in her bed! So i checked the packet and it seems as though actually half the packet of biscuits is infact wet 😭   A bourbon biscuit will have to do instead.

I had an extremely unpleasant service this evening at Tesco Express in Woodford Green (253-269 HIGH ROAD).  I ordered a pram for my baby for collection at the above store. I arrived at the store at 9:40pm (well within the 10pm specified in the email) and was refused by the store manager (so he claimed to be) as it was  too late .  I challenged him  and to my disbelief he admitted he did not want to go to the trouble of getting my order as he wanted to go home on time.  Does it really take 20mins to get a collection  instead he chose to be difficult for the next 20mins (surely he could have got my order in that time)?!  This is totally disgraceful  even when I explained that my baby needed a pram the following day.  I am speechless.  Tesco  is this really acceptable?
Please don t stop selling gluten free chicken nuggets. My 5 yr old loves them!

I have recently sent my phone back to you or repair as it was faulty  today (after a week without phone) I have been sent back another faulty phone that doesn t work. Hi tesco!!! I have got to say you are in my very very bad books this evening. So today I went to your Middleton store to buy the ingredients for a lovely paella. Browsing your fish mongers you had a great selection of fresh fish. I decided on fresh cod loin  Raw king prawns and fresh live mussels. So I embarked on cooking up a storm at home for our family Spanish night. The dish was in full swing  almost complete. I opened the prawns and put them in. I opened the mussels and a smell worse than death erupted in my nostrils. The mussels were not live mussels at all they were very very dead and it appeared by the smell that they had been for some time. After this I not only was very disappointed by the mussels the thought of eating the beautiful paella I had loving prepared was turning my stomach. As a fish lover I have got to tell you this saddens me very much. So the £30 on quality ingredients I spent in your store today has literally just gone down the toilet. Thanks tesco 😬😬😬

Received awful service today  I ordered my shopping online yesterday to be collected between 4-6pm  I collected it at 4:40 when I got home and unpacked found a quarter of my order was missing including my children s dinner for tonight. After waiting 6 minutes to speak to a customer service manager the lady I spoke to phoned the store and was told that it was so busy it just got missed. I understand we are all human and mistakes are made but there was no one else there so to lie about it really annoyed me. I was then told that they couldn t deliver my order as all the vans were leaving now and I would have to go to store to collect it and as the click and collect pod closes at 6pm I would have to go to store. So after dragging 3 hungry  tired and grumpy children back to the store I was kept waiting for 20 for my order to be found. Morale of the story don t bother with click and collect unless you have time to check every item is there!

I came into your Eastbourne store today to buy a gluten free sandwich to find none there! And instead in its place  where it is marked down for two different free from sandwiches  some pasta..which I cannot eat! This is not the first time it s happened either. Over the past few months I ve come in to grab a quick sandwich on the run to find nothing there and instead something else I can t eat in its place when it clearly states free from and there has never been any tags to say the items are not in stock.  I can see you probably don t stock very many and may run out by lunchtime but I have been in first thing in the morning  mid morning..basically all times of day and have never seen anything there but again something I can t eat. I have only ever been able to buy a free from sandwich once from your Eastbourne store and that was when they first came out.  It would also be a good idea to have some other alternatives instead of just a plain boring chicken salad(which never has enough chicken in!) maybe some free from pasta salads  rice salads or rice noodles would also be a brilliant option to quickly grab on the run and to be in the meal deal as us with health issues and intolerances etc are constantly getting ripped off for something we can t help!  Your free from section is slowly getting better so why not make your fresh sandwich/lunch selection better too?

I never do this but feel I have no choice ... Tesco Direct are a joke ... Purchased TV 3 months ago & 3 weeks ago it just turned itself off & wouldn t turn back on ... When it wasn t collected on the day they said we called them & was put through to a different company called UMC she said they don t collect the TV & instead would send a USB to fix it !!!!!!! Throughout the course of 3 weeks we have had several phone messages left saying they will pick the TV up then messages saying sorry we haven t picked your TV up ... Several emails & phone calls later Tesco Direct tell us we have to take a photo of the front of the TV with it on ... Tesco Direct the whole problem is we can t turn the TV on you morons ... & have now had an 86 year old lady waiting every day for you to do what you promised ... Collect the TV & fix it ... UMC & Tesco Direct worst customer service ever !!!!!

Dear Tesco   I d like to bring to your attention an issue I had in your Alfreton store earlier today. My partner  23 month old son and I popped in quickly to grab some bits and bobs when suddenly my son begins to projectile vomit down one the aisles completely out of the blue. There was an assistant literally standing inches away from us during this and I had to ask twice if she could help us before she walked off without saying a word  I assume to get someone else to deal with it. After waiting in the aisle with my son still vomiting  I ran to see if anyone could help. A passing employee merely said  a cleaners coming  without even offering to help.  Thankfully a lovely customer stopped and opened a bottle of water she d just bought and gave us a material like bag to help clean up my son and partner who were both stood  covered in vomit.  Out of everyone in store today only one lady  a customer  stopped to help and none of your staff to offer any assistance. The customer service was such a disappointment.

Orders 4CTH7XTPF and 4CTV469JY.  Ordered a TV from Tesco Direct on Monday  paying extra for nominated delivery. it arrived with the screen shattered to pieces. Contacted customer services and that model was out of stock. Have to kick up a fuss about the delivery fee and the discount code in order for them to agree to allow me to choose an alternative up to £20 more expensive. Said they could not compensate me for sitting in all day and that the alternative TV would be delivered on Friday. CEO s office contacted me and gave me £50 compensation for the fact I wasted a day of my time etc.  Waited in all day on Friday; I did not leave my home once. I was tracking the delivery on Yodel s website  only for them to update the status to  sorry we missed you  we ve left a calling card . No calling card was left  of course because delivery had not been attempted. Yodel refused to do anything other than to say they would  try again tomorrow . I should point out that they were supposed to be collecting the faulty TV to return to you.  Contacted the CEO s office again. They arranged for the TV to be delivered last night at 8pm from a local store (thank you for that  that was appreciated)  however the driver was not instructed to collect the faulty TV. So now I need to give you access to my home for a THIRD time to collect it. However  given that Yodel said that they would be coming again today  I waited in and the tracker has now been updated to  delay - delivery in the next 72 hours .  Contacted customer services who have said they can arrange collection on a day suitable to me but it will be a window from 7am-7pm. They also want to use Yodel  the company who could not be bothered attempting to deliver on the contracted date and have now still not managed to do so and are expecting to me to wait about for another 3 days.   By now I have wasted THREE days of my time for this complete and utter shambles. There is absolutely no way that I will be wasting a fourth day of my life on this nonsense  waiting around for incompetent no show contractors. You can contact me and arrange a collection on a suitable day and provide me with a reasonable window for collection. I am employed and have things to do not involve sitting in my home like a recluse waiting for you to get your act together.  I fully expect to be compensated for the time I have spent wasted on this ridiculous situation that should have been resolved in 24 hours but almost a week later is still dragging on. My time is easily quantifiable. What sort of amateur show are you running here?  that you cannot deliver a television in an acceptable condition in three attempts?!

Dear tesco  Whilst visiting your diss store today my 5 year old boy decided to pinch a pick and mix sweet and eat it. Hello Tesco x not overly happy with your customer service in the Bulwell store ☹️️ I bought a Tefal Actify from your store last November. Unfortunately its developed a fault. I rang your helpline who were great and they told me to take it back to store and they would exchange it. I took it back this morning and a member of staff at your customer service desk took the details and told us to  go upstairs and see if you can find one   really helpful. We went upstairs and did find one however this one was a newer model and cost more.  Because you no longer stock the old model (and from what I can see it s not on sale anymore)  you expect me to pay the difference! I m disgusted at the attitude I experienced as I quote  obviously it s not our fault and obviously you can t expect Tesco to pay more when it s a Tefal model . Think I will be taking my business elsewhere in future 😡😡

Hi Tesco  you re not doing very well with your online orders are you?  Twice this week I ve made an online order. First time I had an order acknowledgment etc but no order.  Last night I gave it a second chance and ordered £40.25 of groceries for click and collect to be collected between 12 and 2  order acknowledged and payment taken. My stepdad has just gone to collect it to be told there is only £8 worth of groceries as the rest is not actually there and hasn t been since yesterday morning.  I d like to know the following: Why was my order accepted and payment taken if the chosen foods were not actually in stock? Why I had no notification or contact from the online ordering service team to say the chosen items were out of stock? Why are you selling items online that are actually not available?  This is twice that my time has been completely wasted and orders accepted for items that we not available to collect. I believe there are laws against that?  I personally refuse to shop with you. Unfortunately my parents are only just learning  after £80 of online orders  that you aren t worth the hassle.  I would like my questions answered and if they aren t  I will be contacting trading standards about the sale of goods online and payments taken for items you actually don t have in stock.

A while back I tried to purchase one of your meal deals  the dine in two for £10 deal or whatever you like to call it. I m 25 and had valid ID! My boyfriend however is 21 and as it wasn t his shopping nor was he carrying any of it to or near the checkout. The alcohol prompted the girl on the till to ask for ID so without a problem I presented my passport only for her to ask my boyfriend for his once i was about to pay and he walked over to help me... now unfortunately he didn t have any but as I say this wasn t his shopping and he wasn t under 18 but I assume that is irrelevant  I can understand that if it was a group of younger lads or girls next to me who I didn t know or if I didn t have ID but what if I was to try and buy this meal deal with a child of mine ? Would I be asked for ID then is that not exactly the same? You know just in case I want to get my baby drunk (I dont have a baby). I thought it was ridiculous. If he would of been putting the alcohol on the belt or clearly under 18 then I could maybe understand but when I spoke to the manager in store he insisted it was company policy clearly not the challenge 25 policy though. I was just wondering what happens if the random person behind me next time will be asked or maybe the person being served on the opposite checkout! It was just inconvenient that we had to walk to another tesco so I could buy the same deal whilst he waited outside. I m aware of the challenge 25 policy but I m pretty sure if he clearly wasn t purchasing the alcohol the cashier shouldn t be asking him for ID! I ve worked in retail and I m aware you shouldn t buy alcohol for anyone under 18 and will be asked for ID if you look under 25 and that you will not be served if you appear intoxicated however I was not aware you will not be served if there is a person under 25 within a 2meter radius who attempts to help u ?? Just embarrassing and very frustrating! I m sure your sales in alcohol would increase massively if people were actually allowed to buy it with valid ID😕

Hi tesco  I wonder if it would be possible for you to give a staff recognition to a young lady who works in your Sunbury store? Her name was Jemma and she was working last night (23/09/16) around 18.00 on the front customer services desk.  Yesterday evening I was in Sunbury driving around with a very young hungry baby and my 3 year old son. I had been driving around and around for 45 mins and I had got completely lost trying to find a friends new flat where I was meant to be meeting my friend and husband. My mobile phone battery had died and I was struggling to find a pay phone where I could stop safely with the children. I finally saw a sign for tesco and thought they must have a pay phone so I parked the car and went in the store. I asked the security guard if there was a pay phone which he said there wasn t but this young lady heard my plea and immediately offered me the use of the store phone. I was very close to tears as I had no idea where I was  Jemma offered to use her phone to find the road I was looking for and help direct me and then even went as far as seeing if there were any spare chargers laying around that I could use for a few minutes to turn my phone on and let my husband know myself and the children were safe as we were now and hour late!  Luckily my husband answered the call from tesco and they came to rescue me and turned out I was only a few roads away!  Please pass on my thanks to Jemma I am really grateful X X

Hi tesco  today I visited your tesco Axminster in Devon store with my three children  during this time my five year old needed to use the toilet  I usually use the disabled/ accessible toilet but it was currently occupied and him deciding he couldn t wait to took all three of them (pushchair included) into the ladies toilets  which I always dread because of my son s sensitivity to loud noises/fans/handriers/hoovers etc. . After a few minutes a lady came out of the cubical and washed her hands and went to use the handriers  before she did she asked me if it was ok and if the kids were ok with the noise. My son turned to her and said he didn t like the noise the lady said ok and didn t use the hand drier and left. I was so so grateful as it s one less battle to face  after she left I burst into tears because she was so nice and noone has ever asked before.   Turns out her name was chloe and she works there. Just wanted to say you employ some bloody amazing staff.   <3

NOT a good shopping experience today at Tesco extra grimsby  I was with my mother and we had finished our shopping and I had packed it in the car  I then remembered I had forgot to get a box of  100 make your own cigarette tubes   I went back into the store to purchase a box of them and they was £1.06  I didn t have any pound coins in my purse so gave the lady a £10 and 10p  she then gave me 4p change.  I asked her where my change was and she said I had only given her £1.10  I knew what money I had in my purse and knew I had given the lady a £10 and 10p.  The lady still kept insisting I had only given her a £1 coin  so I then asked her to do a till check.  The lady dissapeared for what seemed like ages  over 15minutes and when she came back a bit red in the face said I must have been right as her till was £9 up and apologised. That IS NOT good enough do you know how embarrassing it is to near enough be called a liar when you know you are right.  There were other people walking past me aswell  I was getting quite worried as that meant I would have £9 less for my top up shopping in the week and sweat was pouring off my head.  Yes I got the money back but that is not the point it was very humiliating stood at the front of the store waiting for her to come back after doing a till check.  When I got to the car I ended up in tears and am still quite upset about the whole experience!.

Very disappointed in your Rugby store today. I had pre ordered a quantity of bread rolls to be collected this morning at 10am. That nice woman who works at Tesco s supermarket. Good looking. Happy. Always smiling. Big smile. Nice white teeth. I like her voice  soft  can t quite place it. Grey blue eyes. Not too much make-up but red lipstick (I like that). She s got lightish brown hair. Quite long. Always has it up. In a bun (I think it s called). Her yeah. That s the one. I like her. She s a little bit cuddly looking. Am I allowed to say a bit plump? It s in a nice sort of way. If she s on the check out counter I always go to her till. Even if I have to wait for the queue to go down. I think she only works part time   cos some days she s not anywhere to be seen  even if I go in several times. She ain t got a wedding ring on. Not that that means much these days! Well  anyway she has noticed that I am on an organic diet because  well she mentioned it actually. She said to me - when I was shopping last Tuesday it was  - she said to me - well sort of exclaimed it really - she said   my goodness  what a lot of healthy shopping!  So I told her about me being on this organic diet and that  and how it s made me feel tons better and about me walking a lot easier and all that. And she seemed really interested. She said she might give it a go herself. But d you know what she said after that  when I was putting me shopping into me shopping bag? Funny thing is  even me shopping bags one of them organic ones! D you know what she said? No course you don t you weren t there. She said - and she had her lovely big smile on when she said it. Looked me right in the eye she did - she said   well I must say   she said   I must say  you do look really well on it  a lot better.  Well  I ll tell you what. I was made up with her saying that I can tell you. Not just because it means me organic diet must be working. No  not just  cos of that. No  but because if she thinks I look a lot better now than I did before  it must mean she has noticed me before. You know what I mean? Well  it must mustn t it? I reckon she fancies me. Grace her name is. She didn t tell me. It s on her badge. She s really nice! PS. This is just a story. I made the whole thing up. Although I wouldn t be at all surprised if women do think I look good on me new diet!

I visited your store at Brookfield Farm in Cheshunt today with my 9 month old daughter. It was lunch time so I looked for a place to feed her. Harris and Hoole was full so I went into Giraffe and asked if I could sit to feed my daughter. I was told no as it was a restaurant  I needed to order something. I was most shocked to be spoken to like that and quite upset as my daughter was clearly unhappy and hungry.  Feeling humiliated I went back into Tesco and asked at customer services if there was somewhere I could feed my daughter. The lady said the baby room and took me. To say I was disgusted is an understatement. It was dark  small and stank from the nappy bin. I refused to feed my daughter there and was forced to go and sit outside.   I have been using this store for years and never have I been so disappointed  upset or humiliated. Why Tesco thinks it s acceptable to feed a child in a dark smelly room is beyond me. I would like to see the Tesco staff sit and eat in there. In future I will be feeding my daughter before shopping and certainly will not be going into Giraffe again.

Hi Tesco  I very rarely complain  I understand mistakes happen but tonight I have been in your Annfield Plain branch where I was charged for 24 cans of Fosters lager when the box only contained 20 cans. SO DESPITE YOU ASSURING ME LAST NIGHT THAT YOU WOULD LOOK INTO THIS AND CONTACT ME TODAY - I HAVE HEARD NOTHING!!!  I ve had my foot op and I m now home and I m very very disappointed.  This is not the level of customer service that I expect from TESCO.  Appalling customer service from Tesco Direct. Ordered a new Sim- only mobile on 18/9 for delivery 20/9 at my local Click and Collect store. on 20/9 I get an email saying sorry  it s been delayed  will be there tomorrow (today). So today I waited and waited for the confirmation e-mail - nothing - not even another  sorry email . I decide to check online to see what has happened to my order. Status says  not dispatched . So I phone customer services  wait ages to get through  she doesn t know  she ll contact the  partner company . Then I just get put through and have to go through the whole story again. Appliances Direct lady says my order isn t showing on their system so she can t help. I ask to be transferred back to Tesco Direct. I speak to a gentleman  who after a bit of investigation  assures me my phone was delivered to the C&C at 11am this morning. However  when the very helpful gentleman at the C&C tries to find my order in store  there is no sign of it. I come back home and phone the Tesco Direct customer services again & go through the security for the 4th time. After speaking to a supervisor  the customer services assistant says unfortunately there s nothing they can do as Appliances Direct are now shut until tomorrow. Now tomorrow I am having an operation and I wanted to have this phone while I was in hospital to play around with and familiarise myself with the new functions  it is a foot operation so I won t be able to walk or drive to collect this phone and it is likely I ll still be in hospital when anyone phones back to let me know the outcome. The money  of course  was taken from my credit card immediately. TESCO - this is not good enough - I went through your website because I thought it would give me piece of mind that my phone would be delivered on on the day stated. You are obviously only interested in getting my hard-earned money and not in good customer service - many companies don t debit the account until the item has been dispatched. Don t use partner companies if they can t hold up to your usual standard of customer service. Please let me know what you intend to do about my phone - i don t care which colour I get  I just need a new phone to keep me in contact with my friends while I am stuck indoors after my operation.

I went to your Hemsworth store last night and bought a mango and passion fruit smoothie opened it to realise it was out of date .i went straight to customer services where the employee was quite rude to be fair .
