The lady at customer services sorted out a goodwill voucher which was a nice gesture but I still obviously wanted a refund on the out of date product I had purchased .your employee was very rude at this point and said he had given me a goodwill gesture and that was all the goodwill I was receiving . Eventually I was refunded on the out of date product much to your customer service employees disgust . The rudeness of the staff last night was disgusting it wasn t my fault they are selling out of date smoothies but I know I m entitled to a refund . If this is how staff are trained to talk to customers I m disgusted and considering shopping in the local asda instead where I know the staff are not rude and certainly don t speak to their customers in that manner for something that isn t the customers fault . Sadly I have been awoken yet again in the middle of the night by the noise made by the delivery lorries at your Braunton store. Dear Tesco I started studying at Worcester university and was beyond excited  even more so when I arrived and saw what an amazing location my halls were however on our fifth night in our flat we were woken up by loud banging at 12 at night which contuined till 1.30am and is still going on as I write this. No offence but I am  paying all this money on rent to live near the city campus at Worcester and Tescos Express (the building underneath our flats) on Foregate street are doing construction at 12 in the night?! At 1:30 we asked them to keep it down and we are met with rudeness?! We are all awake in the building and will be till 6am  apparently  as that is when we finish?!  We all have to get up early for lesson tomorrow morning and all management can do is close the door and say we were warned... when?! There was no letter through the door or any verbal warning when I was in the shop yesterday! My fellow students in the building and I are all paying  £9000 a year for our education and no one can sleep  meaning our early morning will be hard.  One of my flat mates is trying to catch a train home in the hope of getting a little sleep tonight!!! We had no warning  no letter through the door nothing  we would have understood if there was warning or maybe an explanation on why they are disturbing our sleep?! If this was the other way around we as students would be put through the ringer. I am not exaggerating the amount of noise  as being on the first floor flat my flat mates and I are beyond disappointed by the response we have had from Tescos  the university security and police and we will all be making formal complaints to Tesco and the Council.  Jessica Brown Chloe Mcsorley Haris Majeed Robyn Batchelor Emily Barrett !!!!!!!!

As a father of twin babies it can often be difficult to find two sets of clothing the right size for my girls I appreciate that. What I don t appreciate is poor customer service. I found a lovely coat in your shop (southend store) that I wanted to get the girls. There was one of each size on the rail which again i understand as the rails are only a certain size. After wandering around for five minutes to try and find someone to ask to have a look out the back for a second of the same size I gave up and went to customer services. Upon asking the lady if she could have a look I was greeted by a short  I can t leave the desk  strange thing to say I thought to myself  surely you can help your customer?? Anyway I asked if she could find someone to have a look for me. At this point I was told everyone in clothing had gone home and only they could access the area with clothing in. Again a strange response surely someone in the store can access this  isn t this what managers are for? Worse still I was then asked what the time was and upon answering 20 past nine I was told  Well if you want to go and do some more shopping there might be someone here about quarter to.  I asked how would I know who to look for only to be told   they will be around somewhere  great customer service... fed up with the less than helpful attitude of this lady I went and done some more shopping  came back and couldn t find anyone. I went back to customer services thinking I could ask the less than helpful worker (because of course she couldn t leave the desk she would be there) only to find that she wasn t there... she was wandering round another part of the store. I regularly spend a lot of money in tesco not only on food but many items for my girls including baby food nappies and clothing. Is this the sort of service that tesco pride themselves on? Am I a valued customer? Is it really that difficult to have an assistant help me when trying to make a purchase? I have been at work all day and can only shop this late as I don t have any other spare time to do this. Needless to say it was not a pleasant experience and you have lost out on a dual purchase for your poor customer service and it makes think why would I return to your store if this is how I am treated!!!!

Hi I would like to inform you of the fantastic customer service I received at the Tesco Lesmahagow branch. Your staff could not have been any more helpful as one woman that works there called Audrey (who I only realised after she had helped hadn t even started her shift yet) approached me and offered to put my shopping on the check out for me  whilst another rang them through. Another woman called Fiona then came up and helped me with my baby  as a first time mum I was very happy to welcome any help being given to me.  Not only did they help me in store they both walked me to my car and helped me load  my groceries. I feel they were very friendly and went over and above their duties to go out of their way to help me. I was just wondering if there was any way these 2 individuals could get the recognition they deserve.  All staff in the Lesmahagow branch are very friendly but these 2 ladies were fantastic to me and certainly made a time that was very stressful for me much easier.  I think they done a fantastic job and should be praised for the kind lovely helpful ladies they are  they are an absolute credit to your store. Appalling customer service from Tesco Direct. Ordered a new Sim- only mobile on 18/9 for delivery 20/9 at my local Click and Collect store. on 20/9 I get an email saying sorry  it s been delayed  will be there tomorrow (today).  So today I waited and waited for the confirmation e-mail - nothing - not even another  sorry email . I decide to check online to see what has happened to my order. Status says  not dispatched . So I phone customer services  wait ages to get through  she doesn t know  she ll contact the  partner company . Then I just get put through and have to go through the whole story again.  Appliances Direct lady says my order isn t showing on their system so she can t help. I ask to be transferred back to Tesco Direct.  I speak to a gentleman  who after a bit of investigation  assures me my phone was delivered to the C&C at 11am this morning. However  when the very helpful gentleman at the C&C tries to find my order in store  there is no sign of it.  I come back home and phone the Tesco Direct customer services again & go through the security for the 4th time. After speaking to a supervisor  the customer services assistant says unfortunately there s nothing they can do as Appliances Direct are now shut until tomorrow. Now tomorrow I am having an operation and I wanted to have this phone while I was in hospital to play around with and familiarise myself with the new functions  it is a foot operation so I won t be able to walk or drive to collect this phone and it is likely I ll still be in hospital when anyone phones back to let me know the outcome.  The money  of course  was taken from my credit card immediately. TESCO - this is not good enough - I went through your website because I thought it would give me piece of mind that my phone would be delivered on on the day stated. You are obviously only interested in getting my hard-earned money and not in good customer service - many companies don t debit the account until the item has been dispatched. Don t use partner companies if they can t hold up to your usual standard of customer service. Please let me know what you intend to do about my phone - i don t care which colour I get  I just need a new phone to keep me in contact with my friends while I am stuck indoors after my operation.

I m hoping someone will respond to my query   I m a Welsh woman living in England and the one thing I miss from home is Welsh butter  Every week I go to Tesco hoping to see some of this amazing butter on your shelves  Scottish butter Irish butter English butter but no Welsh   I have purchased all of your salted butters (may as well me unsalted in my opinion ) and none hit the taste buds like good old Welsh butter!!  WHY DO YOU NOT SELL WELSH BUTTER TESCO ????

What is going on with Tesco s? I ve been a loyal customer for over 40 years. No longer.  The products I used to buy every week have now been discontinued  even though they were popular  admitted by one store manager. I can buy them on line if I like. No thank you. If you buy stuff on  line  you get no choice as to what they deliver to you  as found out from experience.  Sorry  we do not have that item  but we sent you this instead  and we have charged you for it!   Sell by dates are getting shorter and shorter and the fresh food is anything but! Fresh that is! And offers are anything but offers. A friend posted this today (I m sure she won t mind me passing this on.)   Really annoyed with TESCO S. Last week I needed to buy my usual Quaker Oats but noticed that the price had jumped from £1.09 to £1.99 (nearly double). They had then put a  special offer  notice next to it of 2 for £3. I m sure that you don t need me to work out the maths for you. Obviously  I didn t buy it  but went to Morrison s where I bought it for £1 a packet  (cheaper than Tesco s normal price). Today  I went again to Tesco s to do my weekly shop and just thought that I would check the price of the Quaker Oats. It was still on the  so-called  offer. Upon mentioning it to a member of staff and telling them that it was a total RIP-OFF and a CON  the answer was   Yes  I know. They all do it!  Come on  TESCO S. This is not fair on your loyal customers and do you really think that we are all totally gullible and stupid? How many other items  (some probably far more expensive)  have had the same  special offers ? STOP RIPPING-OFF your customers!   Ive given up now and shop at Lidl most of the time....

I bought a Vidal Sassoon hair dryer about 3 months ago I bought it with my grocery shop and didn t keep the receipt when I tried to return it to your Springhill Store in Bangor they said I had to contact your care line so they could check my clubcard to prove I bought it there so I did as requested and now have to wait 72 hours for you to check if I bought it. I have never returned a product to Tesco so I AM SOME WHAT HORRIFIED that a hairdryer which cost £20-25 is going to take that long to replace I have had a stroke and now have no way of drying my hair please resolve this as I have enough difficulties with my stroke and drying my hair is an essential.You are not so slow at taking my money at the check out or when I shop online its not like the item is £100s its a small amount I have been left very annoyed by this matter and I am now sitting with wet hair

This is the second time I have had to raise the same issue; and this time I won t just be writing on this page i ll be screaming about this all over social media and posting this message on review sites on the internet including on your competitors webpages to boost their business. At approximately 13:30 I went to your Tesco express store on 780-790 Bath Rd  Hounslow TW5 9SL. The member of staff whose behavioural issues I have already raised with Tesco was once again manning the till; there was a G4S man working under the till; and all tills was closed for what would be a few seconds; this cashier who did have a name badge on this time (Beatrice) said to the people waiting at the front of the queue  its not working  and pointed to the self service; I then approached the till and pointed to the bottle of whiskey and said that i would pay on self service. the abrupt reply from beatrice was  its not working  i said yes i know if u hand me the item in question ill pay for it on self service; again the abrupt reply was  its not working  at this point the manager ok d her to use the till she in her usual rude manner said  which one u want  I named the brand and said i would like the small one; she automatically picked the biggest bottle and i again reiterated  the small one  this time she picked the second largest; I realised at this time she was being difficult on purpose (which coincidently was why I complained about her the first time around) I had to correct her a third time at which point she complained that I had not told her the exact volume of the bottle; I was beginning to loose my cool with her at this point and said  you are being difficult as usual  I than looked at the manager and said  are you the manager  to which he replied  yes ; I said to him this member of staff has an attitude problem and is consistently rude to customers; at this point beatrice chimed in and said  NO U ARE RUDE!!!  i looked at the manager and said  are u just going to stand there mate or do u have something to say  he just kept starring blankly in front of him as if he didn t know what to do; I said to beatrice  i will complain to the head office about this  and her blatant reply was  you can complain as much as you like ; the manager till standing there pretending he can t see or hear anything. Normally i would hand he money to the cashier but i was so furious with her and the lack of intervention from her manager that i dropped the cash on the till rather than handing it over  beatrice at this point again in an aggressive manner said  don t you throw money at me  clearly she doesn t know what throwing money at someone or something really means; i d had enough of her by this time and said to manager could you at least come over and serve me; which he did. having raised a similar issue with a manager in the branch before; the manager who on this occasion was stocking just briefly looked at me and said  yeah sorry bout that  and than turned and started stocking the shelfs again and only agreed to speak with beatrice when he was contacted by your head office about the complain; however this time round it was even worse; the manager was right there and made no attempt to intervene and take over the situation at any point (i didn t get his name but would describe him as a young asian guy wearing thick rimmed glasses; there are about 7 other shops in the immediate vicinity of your tesco who are family run businesses and realise being rude to customers will hit your profits; your shop however is staffed by rude cashiers driving business away and a useless management who seems unable to do anything about them; and since you are employing and paying this person to be the face of tesco I will make sure that you don t only loose out on getting my money but also share this experience with as many people as possible to insure you loose thousands of pounds because of this one member of staff.

Thanks so much Tesco giving me the opportunity to pay much more for my bag of  frozen fruit than I used to . Used to buy a 90p bag of fruit (mainly melon with a few other cheap fruits) but have now discovered that you have doubled the size of the bag and knocked the price up to £3 whilst adding a few (and I mean a few) tiddly little sour looking strawberries. This is the way you seem to be going. Your profits and sales fell so you took it upon yourselves to simply increase prices whilst stating that you were decreasing your offers to concentrate on reducing your fresh prices. This apparent reduction in offers seems to have spread to your everyday cheaper items which you are jiggling with to try and fool people. Uncle Ben microwave rice used to be a regular offer at 99p yet now the offer is buy 2 for £3. You got rid of Bisto ready meals that were 99p and replaced them with you own (very low meat but not bad tasting) meals. You are slowly but surely bringing yourselves up to the price point that Sainsbury s have driven me away with and Lidl s is starting to once again become an attractive option. Your apparent sales increase of late is  in my opinion  driven more by price increases than by a new formula that is winning you back customers. New Milton store.

Really poor customer service today in your Talbot Green store. I returned a rug doctor cleaner and the lock was broken on the locker so I informed customer services as proof I had returned it.   After waiting a few minutes for Gill and Joanna to finish their conversation I spoke to Gill and told her the problem. I was immediately met with  it s nothing to do with us  and I would have to inform rug doctor themselves! I m sorry  it was rented from Tesco! Why should I have to inform them? I only wanted a slip of paper saying I had returned it.   After numerous attempts to tell Gill I was a customer of the store and Tesco logos are plastered all over the lockers a manager was called.  He assured me he would contact rug doctor  took a picture of it and acknowledged it was returned. Why couldn t this be done in the first place?    Very disappointed especially as these women are your customer service team! Not great customer service I m sure you ll agree. I  eagerly await your response.   Gavin Rees

Really disappointed with the Customer service from Tesco today.   I purchased an Xbox One S from Tesco Brooklands  I paid some of the cost in Tesco clubcard vouchers and some on my debit card. I ordered this at the click and collect counter. The transaction was voided twice! I have 2 transaction void receipts. The Lady at the Click and Collect counter assured me that the money would not come out of my account as I had the voided receipts. Today I get an email from my bank saying I have no money in the account. On further investigation on my part I see the transaction has come out 3 times from Tesco. I have spoken to a gentleman in Customer Service this morning at 11am - he said he would call me back.  Still no call!!!! I have then called back Tesco 3 times today and gone over the story as many as well! As no-one was calling me!! Tescos are now telling me that the money is being refunded by my bank not them.  This is not the case as my bank has authorised the payment to Tesco and the money has left my account.  No refund will be coming to me from my bank. I am out of pocket £213 today and have no money to buy food for my family tonight as a result!!! I shop at Tesco everyday and see this as very poor customer service! How are you going to resolve the situation? I have been told by Tesco Brooklands that I have to schlep over to them for them to credit me with the funds as it cannot be done over the phone!  So I have to take time out of my day  use my petrol and valuable working day time to rectify a Tescos mistake.  They have said they can offer me £20 voucher and a bunch of flowers as a way of apology. I do not see this as good enough.   Seeing as I have no money today to buy food  have DDs going out of my account which may not go out due to current lack of funds!   What can you do as ways of compensation?

Yet again ive brought potato salad from tesco and its in date and bloody off!

So today I get made to feel like a low life by Tesco Manager because I bought a faulty item a few weeks ago and no longer have the receipt or packaging. All I wanted was a replacement of a £5 Bluetooth GPS tracking Tag purchased from the petrol station that stopped working the next day  but all I got was   how do we know you bought it from here? you could have bought it from Morrisons or Asda for all we know   obviously if I had bought it from elsewhere I would be there asking for a replacement. I tried to explain my statutory rights as a consumer but all I got was  well I don t have any way to tell if it was bought from here so I can t do anything if you don t have the receipt or packaging . She then said if I didn t have a receipt i could show a bank statement to which I advised her that bank statements don t itemise items only what you paid  and she said well at least it would say Tesco petrol Station wouldn t it? I said yes it would but it wouldn t say what i bought  I said I ve just been to the petrol station now should I come back in a couple of days and show you that one? I even showed her my statutory rights of repair or replacement without a receipt or proof of purchase online  and she said that doesn t matter we teach our people to refuse without receipt or packaging. The thing is the packaging is universal so everywhere that sells these has the same packaging so again her argument was flawed. I asked that if i went to the citizens advice bureau what would they say  and she agreed that they would tell them to replace it but this didn t really matter as they just decide for themselves. In the end  I asked once again nicely and she agreed (on this occasion) to a replacement  but this was a very unpleasant experience over something that should have taken 2 minutes to resolve  not 3 visits and a conversation with a confrontational manager. She was already aware of the issue before speaking to me and so had already made her mind up as the staff from the Petrol station had spoken to her before I went to the store.

Very disappointed please can you explain why the same product that you sell in store is a different price to one that I can do click and collect is much cheaper? I would have thought your own store would price match your own online store. So I go to store to purchase a lego product where it is £35 in store but same product is £27.99 on Tesco direct. To be told I have to order via click and collect and they won t sell it for the same price. I understand you don t have to price match other companies but your own company is a joke! Before you tell me you are two different companies like I was just told in store that won t wash as you are quite happy to deliver products online to store to be picked up so not that much different in companies are you.

Most disappointed with Tesco Alsershot today.. After dressing my three month old and actually managing to get out the door (any new mum will understand to get out the door is no mean feat)  I arrive at Tesco Aldershot feeling accomplished and ready to face the dreaded weekly shop  I get out my car to discover firstly the nearest single baby seat trolley to put my daughter in is a half mile away at the other end of the car park... So... I pull my sleeping child out of her car seat walk a marathon across the car park to get the trolley only to discover it s dirty and has a wonky wheel but at this point Iv just walked the length of the car park to get it so I carried on. Walking into the store I was on the look out for a different trolley I managed to find one (also dirty) but it s a double so it was about the size of a boat (I only have one small child) I placed her in it anyway as I thought it might be better and I just want to get shopping... it s no better still has a wonky wheel and still dirty but at this point I m getting fed up and my child is getting ratty with all the swapping seats. I got in and managed to get round the veg but after nearly taking out a bunch of other shoppers and my daughter becoming sea sick as the boat was such a bumpy ride I decided to ask the security guy to see if he could find me another trolley (he was the only staff member I could find) He came back with a double trolley also dirty and also with a wonky wheel!   Yes this is the third baby trolley I m on now!  At this point I m really fed up I just wanted to get in do my shop and get out  when I told the security guy that it s just as bad he advised me I just needed to walk around the store slowly.... Are you kidding me... I don t have time to pee by myself let alone walk around the store slowly!  I then found a Tesco staff member and told her it was unacceptable and asked her to remove the items from the self scanner as at this point I ve had enough and wanted to leave.   She arranged for me to speak to the duty manager who offered to find me another trolley ...my answer was NO!  He did apologise and advised me they should have new baby trollies arriving in store soon very helpful when I need to shop today!  The duty manager then turned to a cashier and asked her if they had any new baby trollies to which she stared blankly back at him 👌  I left the store with no shopping and feeling very deflated me and my husband are now very hungry this evening.  Thank you Tesco for a thoroughly  disappointing and frustrating trip 👍

Hi There   I live by a Tesco in Cambridge  and also by the most incredibly lazy people I have ever known. (I ve lived in Stoke).  I witnessed (again) with my own eyes a woman leave a Tesco trolley outside my house (an able bodied woman riding a bike(yeah a bike(yeah she was pushing a trolley with a bike(How? Science B****))). Anyway  as I drove passed her to park my car  she looked a bit shifty  like she had been caught doing the deed  like the way someone looks when they ve been caught eating all your jaffa cakes that you bought for yourself and not you MIKE   I was sure that as I parked my car in the garage she would take it back.  PLOT TWIST: She didn t.  I watched her bike off into the sunset  with 2 bags on her handles. 2 Bags. TWO.BAGS. Probs some Fig biscuits (Tescos)  Loo roll and a copy of Grazia.  I ve setup closed circuit surveillance cameras at the perimeter of my house to catch this crazed animal walking passed. I ve also called Bill Oddie (an experienced bird watcher) to try to get a glimpse of who it was. Employing Oddies years of Birding  Sleepless nights and microwave meals (Tescos) for 2 have led to nothing. Apart from the terrible nausea (don t ask)  the only thing I caught was my gf going to the gym (again) with a very close friend of hers (male).  Bill has since quit birding.  It s been there ever since last Tuesday. Just sitting there  like a dead badger (minus the smell and general mess that a dead animal makes). It s now a scene of rage and anger  greeting me every morning I go to work  and every time I walk to Tesco PLC.   I wake up sweating  like a scene from hollywood when someone jolts forward out of bed with sweat dripping down their face  wishing I had never witnessed such a callous disgusting act.   I wonder sometimes  if I should go out and take in that badger and keep it as my own. But I know that the stench of it  I mean trolley not badger  would reek out my usually clean cream cotton curtains and cushiony carpet. (Usually Febreezed(Asdas (sorry was closer to work)).   I also wonder if on the 5 ocassions I ve walked to tescos since  that I should just push it there. But the thought of letting myself forgive her  really gets on my wick.  Anyway  I digress. I was just wondering how much your Tiger bread is?  Kidding  can you get one of the lads to come get it? (trolley). It s located at CB19GJ.   Tom

Oh Hi  T   me again  hope you re ok and the family is well? I feel now after several mails and posts I can skip the formality of using your full name and abbreviate. I wanted to let you know things have taken a more sinister turn. As you know from one of my other correspondence it was my sons birthday party on Friday night. The Mattresses I have accumulated due to your incompetence were stored in my unborn babies room. I had told the kids to stay out of said room. Anyway  today my friend contacted me to say her 5 year old daughter hasn t returned home from school. After a mass panic and a confession of hide and seek in the babies room from my son we found  chaniqua  huddled under a fallen mattress. She s been there 3 days!!!!!! Luckily she said she slept well so kudos to you on quality. I was telling my journalist pal about your idiocy on my wall and she mentioned I should perhaps play you at your own game  so here goes.... You sent me 2 mattresses that didn t fit and a third that did for a bed I couldn t use for 4 weeks. I had to keep buying the mattresses for a bed I couldn t use because you won t refund until collection. Your collection courier wouldn t collect because a 27 week pregnant lady couldn t wrap the mattresses. You had me spend days chasing you and so far all responsibility has been placed on me despite your admission that it was incorrect web details on your site that caused this. Still no refund  still full of mattresses and still angry! So  I now start backdating you fees I have accumulated. 1) a packer usually makes £8.11 an hour accounting to JSPlus website. I ll pack the mattress regardless of my health and body shape but I ll invoice you an hours pay. To store items in a rental storage it costs £22.50 a week according to easy store. I ve been storing your stock now for 4 weeks and so that s a further £90 you owe me. You have kept my money for such time also and so I will also be charging interest as of tomorrow. Each correspondence according to my pal who is a solicitor would have cost me £35 had I not paid my Tesco card bill. So I shall also be working out how much I ll charge for emails and posts.  I appreciate that at times there s a jovial tone to my mail. This is due to the fact I am hormonal and fear for public safety if I don t stay calm. But don t misunderstand me  I am seriously  unstable and ragged with rage! I killed a wasp today T  and I enjoyed it! This is on you! A woman complains on your site about her little kids not getting free fruit as she shops and you re straight in there with an apology. I complain that you re withholding my money for items I didn t order  refusing to collect them unless I exert myself in pregnancy and yet NADA! Don t make me use my minority card (I m ginger) because you re pushing me to it  T! Did I also mention I m a stress eater? If this carries on I ll also be charging you for a whole new wardrobe as I m stuffing my face to cope! Yours  seriously peed off now  Mel of Burnley!

Hi  I just wanted to pass on my thanks to the fantastic team from your Barrow-in-Furness Extra store who were at their Colour Splash event yesterday. Unfortunately I had a fall whilst I was there and have fractured my ankle. Your staff were fantastic  from trying to make me as comfortable as possible including one staff member offering her jacket to keep me warm  phoning for an ambulance  trying to keep my spirits up through the pain and most importantly helping comfort my upset children  wiping their tears and giving them a cuddle and a bit of reassurance. They were a credit to Tesco especially and I will definitely be attending future events once I m back on my feet  but will try to be a bit more careful next time!

Just thought I would write a little about my experience with Tesco Home Delivery from the Warrington  Winwick Road Store on the weekend (Sept 17th 2016)...So I have a delivery from you every weekend and I have done for a very long time. This weekend however my husband took me away Friday night so I booked my delivery for Sunday AM instead of my usual Saturday AM (or so I thought I had). We arrived home roughly about 6pm Saturday only to have the police knock at the door 5 minutes later. I had only booked my delivery for Saturday AM by mistake and the driver had tried to deliver to me 3 times without success. As I am always there to welcome them  they found it out of character and phoned the police as they were concerned for my welfare! I didn t really pay any attention to my phone the whole weekend and completely missed the reminder text and my phone was off most off Saturday so missed the phone calls from the Store and the Police! So I charged my phone straight away so I could call Tesco and within minutes of me turning my phone on the Store rang me  checking I was OK and letting me know that my delivery is fine and they would just deliver to me tomorrow instead. Then 5 minutes later the store called me again and said that someone was on their way and would be with me within the next half hour! Considering the mess up was completely my fault  they couldn t have been any more friendly and helpful. Tesco customer service is apparently second to none! 10/10! Unfortunately  with all the commotion  I missed the lady s name that I spoke to on the phone and the chap s name that delivered my shopping so I am unable to thank them personally but Tesco - Thank you for caring. I ll be shopping with you forever!

My husband and are are having a well earned afternoon of peace watching a film together  We purchased 2 bags of your sweet popcorn at the st neots Tesco extra  Only to begin our film and discover the inside of the SWEET popcorn bag contained sweet and SALTED Popcorn  This caused a very grumpy husband
Why can t we see what people have posted on this page other than in response to your posts?

Your quick sale fruit and veg stall is terrific - Morrison s stopped theirs. Today I picked up good quality rasps as well as some lovely aronia berries - wish you had them in quantities to make jam. I also got those miniature kiwi fruit. There s certainly an interesting range of stuff to keep me on the straight and narrow and I am now nearly 2 stone lighter. Pity about all that plastic packaging - good old fashioned cardboard would be so much lighter and cheaper. I also enjoy the interesting new grape types  especially the strawberry miniature grapes and the  tropical  ones.
Last night my son has choked on a bone from your boneless skinless chicken breast fillets. Not happy.

I ordered a load of entertainment food for a function on Saturday 17th which was due to be delivered on Saturday at 11am. The food was also very good (except the sticky chicken sticks!) thank you!

A big thank you to Brian Sally and Sarah at  Tesco Mayflower retail Basildon. Today I went shopping with my baby and 4 year old in tow alone  which is stressful enough as it is but for good measure my 3 month old decided she wanted to be carried as we were nearing the end of our shop. We headed straight for the till where i started one handed loading all my items onto the belt and my 4 year old nearly had a breakdown because we forgot the cake mix 😣 Brian sensed the stress and impending breakdown from said 4 year old and asked someone to grab it for me 👍. With that Sally and Sarah came over took over the unloading and packing from me and Sarah even helped me to the car loaded it in the boot and put the trolley away. They were all amazing and a great credit to Tesco 😇 from now on Tesco Mayflower will always be my first choice.  Thankyou from one very greatful mummy 😀

On Friday  I was in my local store and a lovely lady served me at the checkout. She displayed some strange behaviour trying to stare at my eyeballs which made me feel quite uncomfortable. It took me longer to pack my bags as she kept distracting me by chatting about how her chipped nail varnish was irritating her. It didn’t take me long to figure out what was going on. Especially when I observed the slapdash way she gave me my change  checking it only once. She wasn’t autistic like me  she was neurotypical. She must have been a high functioning neurotypical seeing as she had a job. Tesco make me proud offering these opportunities to neurotypical people. Neurotypicals deserve an equal chance in life and employers like Tesco help them by providing it. Who knows how her life would have turned out if Tesco hadn’t given her a chance? I have neurotypical people in my family and Tesco have given me hope for their future. Thank you Tesco.

Went to Tesco at blue boar lane in Norwich today after a failed attempt at shopping at a different supermarket which was humiliating. I have anxieties and had a panic attack  it took about half an hour to drive to the tesco  and i still felt on the verge of tears upon arrival. I had my children in tow  my 3 year old son who causes trouble whenever he can like any other child  and my 8 year old daughter who is autistic. I asked at customer services if someone could help us with our shop today as I had no carer with us and we d just had a horrible experience elsewhere. They were amazing! Our list wasn t a long one  and Sam was very patient as we perused DVDs and books and bits that weren t listed. She got the kids involved with choosing things and helping  and when the children had had enough the rest was found quickly. She opened a new till so there was no queueing to pay  and found us someone to help us to our car who was also an absolute star.  We have just reached home and my eyes are once again on the verge of tears  but this time ones of gratitude. Those lovely women deserve something extra special  they absolutely saved our Sunday 🙂  Thankyou so so much for all the help and support!

Dear tesco   On 3 separate occasions this year I have visited your Stretford store in Manchester to purchase a toy with my 8 year old son. On every occasion we have left empty handed with a very sad little boy to deal with. You see  he always finds the toy he wants (wwe figures) but everytime we take it to the check out it gets taken away as there is no record of it on your system!! Why is this? Why do you continue to have them on the self if they can t be sold?  On these 3 occasions  we  have left the store without much of an explanation other than  sorry you can t have it!   However today was different. My sister took my son in to purchase a figure as a gift whilst I stayed in the car with my sleeping baby. 10 minutes later they returned to the car empty handed once again and my son was extremely upset. The man at the customer service desk had told them there was no record of it therefor it could not be sold. When my sister questioned why it was on the self with a security sticker on he said that it shouldn t be there.  I returned straight away with my son seeking a better explanation and we witnessed the same man returning the toy to the self. Once again we picked it up and went back to the check out only to be told we could not purchase it. After refusing to leave without it a very helpful man called Nathan who works there was able to find a barcode on his phone and sell us the toy. WHY DON T ALL THE STAFF KNOW HOW TO DO THIS!! Do you have a better explanation as to why this happens every time?  #thankgoodnessfornathan

I had a very unpleasant trip to tesco extra Dudley last Sunday. I understand that I was a bit mixed up and got my times wrong  I arrived at the store at about 3.55pm  thinking it was open until 5pm. I parked in a parent & child bay on the underground car park and could see a security guard by the door (please bear in mind how close these spaces are to the door)  I then proceeded to take my 13 month old little boy out of his car seat and carry him (along with my empty shopping bags and baby change bag ect) to the trolley bay. I placed my boy I  the child seat and could see the security guard looking over. He watched me spend a fair few minutes adjusting the straps on the seat so that my baby was secure  I then pushed him over towards the entrance so that I could do my shopping  only to be told by the same security guard that the store was now closed and I couldn t come in! I said I thought it was 5pm and he said no it was 4pm  so I asked him why he didn t tell me this before instead of watching me struggle and spend ages securing my boy to the trolley? His reply was that he didn t know if I was coming into store or not! If I had parked there and was strapping him into the trolley  was it not blatantly obvious? I was not impressed! I think anyone with any common sense would have at least shouted over to me and not let me carry on!

Normally I am a patient person and not one to complain but your box insurance team have had an error in communication. Phoned them this morning to say why have I been given two different times and they said to call if the person isn t here between half 1-2 but really the afternoon appointment is between 12:00pm and 4:00pm. I have at around 2pm called they have now said it would be within the next two hours and that I would get a phone call 30 minutes before the person was due to arrive. At 15:49 and the fitter has just got here. There was no 30 minute notice phone call. But not within the 9:00am-12:00pm time slot that i was originally told by the customer service!  I have now wasted my day thanks to the rubbish customer service that has been provided by you and I personally find this unacceptable.

I think you need to sort you call centre out. I have spent 30 minutes on the phone to your  help centre  to try and purchase a television from you as my local store can not do this. Rang the call centre got told to try entering Tesco@ and two numbers of choice.. didn t work as saying my postcode didn t match then rang again gave all my details and was told i have an account but was only asked my name number and first line off address which I gave from being born (which is four btw!) and was told that the account was set up in 2007 and again reiterated the 1st line of address (should know bought it in 2003 until 2013!) Was told it was wrong. Asked if was the same town i had mentioned and was told to email for a freedom of information and pay £10 which i explained i know the Data Protection Act and as I work in a call centre and questioned if i had had club card account then the details have been registered wrong  i was told that could not happen so asked to speak to a manager but the call handler started to give me the freedom of info request email address i stopped him and asked for the call to be escalated to it was the person immediately asked for my post code and confirm my name and the address in lived in 2007. Again after explaining that all i was trying to do was buy a telly from you again the call got transferred...which again i had to go all the information again through security questions and then told i did have an account never used and had no points but they could only put the purchase through as anonymous but to have make sure i have someone over 18 with me (i am 33 btw). Finally i purchased the tv however not got a next day delivery as promised on your website. This is true shocking customer services and will no doubt cost me a fortune on my mobile just to buy a product from Tesco

Tonight I went to my local tesco extra in Andover. I needed milk and deodorant  plus I wanted to purchase a new Xbox one game.  As a disabled customer usually in a wheel chair I like to go late at night  when it is not busy  therefore it s easier to get around  with hardly any people there to have to weave in and out of. Tonight looked very dead. so I thought I would try my crutches. HUGE MISTAKE. I got my milk and deodorant picked up my game and headed for the checkout. I was knackered walking that far  but with my condition it is a real feat but I have to try.  At the check out I was told that I could purchase the milk and roll on but for the game I had to get it at customer services. Not very happy that had to walk more i started my journey  as I got there the check out runner said  you will have to go to music and video department desk for that  I have just called him. (This is the other end of the store!!!) I asked if I had to.  yes  I was told. And with that they left me. So off I went. Got there with a real struggle. I was in a lot of pain and now not happy to be back where I started  knowing I was going to have to walk all the way back. I wished I had got my wheelchair out the back of the car now. No where to sit I stood waiting in pain. Still unable to purchase the game I wanted. No one came. A few minutes passed so I pressed the bell for assistance. Nothing!! No one!! I pressed again every minute or so. I really wanted my game. Before my accident I was a very sporty person and loved playing football and basket ball now I can t so Xbox is as near as I get.  15 minutes passed and no one came!!!! I couldn t stand any longer. It s propably the longest I have stood in months. So I left the game box there and left the store!!  I am appalled that no one once offered me any help  that I was made to walk back and forth for absolutely nothing. I have really hurt myself in the process and I still have no game!!  I think this is a disgusting way to treat any customer let alone a disabled customer.   Think you need to change your company tag line from  every little helps  to  VERY LIITLE HELP    Will not be spending my money with you in future.

Just want to say thank you so much to our local Tesco for upsetting my children earlier at teatime. I always buy them a Num Noms single pot every week from the toy aisle (as I can t get them anywhere else in the town)...... And have done for the last 2 months. There were 3 boxes out on the shelves  some had already gone. So I take them to the till to be told  i can t sell you these  they ve no price on them .  WHY HAVE THEM OUT FOR!!!??? Can you not be bothered to go find out a price!!!???   I told them they are £3  the same price as every week we buy them from in there!   Asked to see a manager...... She was no help whatsoever!!   Both my children were absolutely gutted!! Not happy.

Tonight my husband purchased a Wilkinson s razor from Tesco at Clifton Moor for £12.00. When he got home and tried it out he found it to be very poor quality and it s job. He has just driven the 10 miles back to the store to get a refund to then hopefully purchase a better razor while there however  when he got there the customer services desk was closed which is fair enough but he was then pointed in the direction of a manager by security and the service he received was not acceptable. He explained the issue with the razor to which the manager said well you ve used it  chucked it back in the bag and told him to come back tomorrow.   Firstly of course he s used it  he wouldn t of known it doesn t work if he hadn t tested it out. Secondly he s just just travelled half way across York to get it sorted the same day so would of liked a bit of time and respect. Thirdly I m sure any manager in store is capable of sorting a refund or exchange regardless of whether they work in customer services or not  every person who works in Tesco has a till log on.  My husband could tell the thin manager with glasses who dealt with him was not interested and so fobbed him off which in my eyes is bad customer service. This may seem petty over £12 but its more on the principle of him having travelled all that way to have to come straight home.  I look forward to your reply...

Can I just ask why the size of your own brand toastie loaf is now half the size it was and still the same price?? Used to be an 800g loaf and now its a 400g loaf! So us customers are paying the same price for half the amount! Way to look after your customers Tesco

Hey Tesco  I ve just been fundraising at the Widnes Extra Store for Diabetes UK.  Your staff were great and very helpful  in particular Community Champion Denise.  Had a great time -  thanks for letting us be there :o).
Escorted to my car by a very lovely man with an umbrella  helped unload the trolley and took the trolley away...Fabulous. Loving the new service#fulbourn

Just visited your Rotherham town centre store today (16-9-16)with my elderly mum looking for a pay as you go or sim free phone for her. After much deliberation my mum settled on a motoE phone than was within her bubget  when talking to the assistant and telling him the one she wanted he quoted a much  higher price saying that the price on display was discontinued last week. I asked him why it was still displayed at that price and was told he was not allowed to take it off. I replied that it was false advertising saying a product was one price and selling it at another and at least a discontinued sticker should have been applied or one saying a price change on this product.. His answer was well they are out of stock anyway but we could still get it on amazon or maybe click and collect. I m  afraid you had two very unhappy customers who took their custom to another company who sells you the product at the price it is displayed at. I really query whether this practice is legal  or if it is  is it just a ploy to let the customer choose and then hit them with a higher price. In either case it is very misleading and makes me wonder what other phone price or misrepresented as this is not the first time I have known this happen.
What sort of loyalty programme do you offer?

Thank you for the lovely surprise package today. Took out pet insurance with you for our new kitten and have just received a “Kitten Starter Pack” full of very useful items. Had no idea we were going to get that. Thank you again..

Dear Tesco  This is probably my 8th attempt to rectify an issue regarding the non-delivery of items for our little boys trampoline.   We ordered the trampoline in July  well in advance  for his 7th birthday in August. A number of items were not included in the delivery which resulted in a devastated little boy being unable to have his trampoline birthday party.  When I rang about this I was told  that s what you get for ordering delivery  and  do you think we have time to check every box   In the next delivery some items were still not present and this continues to pose a major health & safety risk as the springs remain uncovered.   I am shocked and genuinely saddened at this service because at the core of it is a little boy who was greatly excited by the prospect of his new trampoline only to have his hopes crushed.  I have rang and messaged your company and have got nowhere. So all I can do is now ask people to like and share this status in the hope our 7year old will finally had his trampoline complete.  Please folks like and share

Shocked and upset at how badly Tesco treats it s customers. I bought a Jemima Tub sofa online. The order was cancelled the next day. When I complained I was told the sofa was actually available so after waiting 5 days for a refund I bought it again. After waiting several weeks for delivery  I get a phone call to say that the order has been cancelled again and I ll have to wait another 6 days for a refund. I have now been without a sofa for almost a month. Unbeliveable.

Can you please tell me why my local branch (Flitwick  Bedfordshire) has such a poor range of craft beers? I m aware that the store isn t the biggest but I was under the impression that  Vocation  beers were being rolled out across the nation (obviously with the exception of Flitwick!)

A couple of weeks ago I was looking for Real Lancashire Eccles cakes at my local Tesco Extra. Couldn t find them and when I asked a manager he said they had been withdrawn because of lack of sales. Strange when for years they ve been on aisle ends used for impulse buying. I have since found out the real reason. Tesco have delayed paying their bills and the supplier has got fed up with them and stopped supplying Tesco. Shame on you Tesco for putting your profits ahead of customer choice. I did wonder why there was an alternative much larger pack of eccles cakes if it was down to lack of sales. The real reason is now obvious to me.

A couple of weeks ago our local store starting doing free fruit for children while we shop. The children loved it and looked forward to it but now it seems to have stopped. Such a shame as it was a brilliant idea.
Tesco goodmayes ... temporary freezers not even chilling. Everything s soft and defrosted. Informed duty manager.. surprise surprise. No action !!!  Health and safely risk!!

Not a very good shop at Tesco yesterday. I managed to pay £5.50 for 1 pepper as the weigh machine thought I had bought 11  (probably my fault with the self weigh machine it was so slow to register that I pressed it again  I do scan and shop)  the white cabbage I bought for coleslaw has been partly frozen in the cool store and is soggy  and I ve just come to use the kettle descaler to find one of the sachets must have been damaged as it s leaked everywhere. All these things noticed once home. Last week the milk was sour. Can I get a refund on the peppers  there s no proof that I didn t actually buy all 11 peppers?!
Tesco you have started to stock popchips ridges but you have left a flavour out what about the sea salt ones tell me you are going to start selling them

not one to complain but absalutly discusted after buying what i thought looked a beautiful piece of irish brisket   couldnt find one bit of meat on it i could eat  it was full of veins of fat all the way through  my trust of tescos produce is at an all time low   rant over

customer service when tesco fail and make a mistake own up and apologise  instead of fleeting excuses and ego of middle mangers taking the moral high ground what i witnessed today has put me off visiting a certain store forever

I have a question tesco    Im from Scotland    The scots are very proud of our produce   be it the meat our live stock provide or the fruit and veg our great farmers produce and of course the scotch whiskey made in our world famous distilleries    Can i ask why then has the fruit normaly packaged as scottish (because it is ) now being packaged as UK produce ?   I find this very very insulting    Also rather a deliberate attemp to remove the scottish banner from produce    The government is doing the same  just look at the report on   Uk whiskey ?? .......... No thats scotch whiskey.  So an update on your process of dessision making regarding the rebranding of scotland as UK . Has this been done with all  english  produced stock also ?  Please update us here in scotland and let us know if anymore scottish produce is to be rebranded as uk ?  Thanks

After doing my shopping online with tesco for over 6 months  last night I was apalled to see that some of the items on my receipt  have been sold at different prices to whats on your website. I have just been on your app to check that I havent made a mistake; and i am correct. Which now makes me wonder  what other items have i bought over the last 6 months that have been at a higher price than they should have been! I have recommended Tesco to many of my friends  and my parents and brother have all started using Tesco on my recommendation. I will be going back to Asda unless i recieve a satisfactory explanation.

Would just like to say how disappointed I was in your Cafe at Silverburn in Glasgow today. My sister and I purchased the Large Fish  chips and peas and 2 drinks. When we got our meals we only got a small half of a fish each and couldn t even eat it as the batter was so overdone we couldn t even cut through it. The size of the half small slice of fish was a joke. And the peas where cold. Couldn t believe how bad it was. Also shouldn t be on board as large fish when you only get half a small fish. Will not be going back again. Diane.

Disappointed with the online order service! Placed an order for some beer and wine as a gift  email confirmation  2 texts confirming delivery but nothing delivered. Spoke to a lovely lady on customer service line who informed me that the store had cancelled the order! It would have been nice to have got a call or email telling me  now stuck with no gift! Unusual sub standard service from Tesco

Tried to do my first click and collect order and it was a nightmare.  It wouldn t let me pay.  I was going to try again this morning but I ve lost the collection time and instead of being free I ll have to pay.  Tesco Customer Service answer  IT problems last night  you can t get the collection time back  you will have to pay .  Not a good first experience.

I am disgusted with the treatment I received  from Tesco. My shopping was scheduled for delivery last night between 8-9 by 9.30 no shopping had arrived without any call either. I phoned them and they said they would phone back which they never did  so I called them at 10.45pm and they still couldn t give me an answer as to where my shopping was. The person I spoke to then asked if I would like to reschedule for Friday with an 8-9am delivery which I can t have as I work so I cancelled my shop. I phoned to complain on Friday morning to be told they had no slots and I could have a £10 voucher  what a slap in the face. I WILL NOT SHOP THERE AGAIN  what a disgrace.

Having just seen an article on the new stating that our Foodbanks are running low I ve had an idea that  in theory  is pretty simple. Many people  like myself order online for convenience and I admit that i would genuinely donate to Foodbanks but lack the time to go to them to donate. As well as the  have you missed these offers etc  section right before you check out online  why not have a simple  like to donate an item? . People like myself can simply click on an item or 2 which can simply go into a collection of non perishables at the store ready to be picked up by the local foodbank on set days. Simple yet effective because  as you say  Every little helps .
Regarding Tesco Stokenchurch.  Please sort out the alarm which has been going off every night this week and several nights the week before!! Can t put up with being woken every single night anymore!!

Dear Tesco  Please could you explain why you are selling Chicken sourced from Thailand where there are no  or virtually no welfare rights? I notice that your chicken sourced from Thailand is very much cheaper than UK sourced chicken  that surprises me as the transport costs must be very high. Could this be because it s cheaply produced in factory farms where chicken welfare is non existent? Can you tell me if a vet is present during the slaughter process and if Tesco monitors the whole process from hatching to slaughter  if so can you please show evidence of this?   I notice that your British produced chicken meat is clearly labelled  a union flag is displayed prominently on the packaging and it seems you want your consumers to know that it is British.  Why do you not label the Thai chicken the same?  Is it because the public would be  put off ? After all dog and cat is consumed in Thailand  frequently the cats and dogs are boiled or skinned alive  this does make me wonder about how the chickens are slaughtered.  Please can you explain why you import chicken from Thailand  this can t do your carbon foot print much good.
Your alarm at Tesco Express Stokenchurch has been going off every night for a week now! It s killing me! 🔫🔫 manager knows  nothing done! Help!!!!!
I would like to complement Rob for his poems and songs on Williams day of death thanks Rob! #RIPWILLIAM 😭

MASSIVE shout out to Michael  security guard at the Wigan Extra branch for giving me boxes and even loading them into my car. Such a friendly guy and exceptional customer service.  Please give him the credit he deserves.

Cannot believe how rude a member of the Goodmayes tesco staff was to myself and a friend. The store is 24 hours and some aisles are clearly closed because of store improvements but there are restocking carts everywhere and we were in an aisle for a good four minutes looking at products and then an employee tells us the aisle is closed (which we apologised for  having not realised because the store is 24 hours) and then we moved into the neighbouring aisle and we can hear her talking about us to her colleagues. This is unacceptable! And there was NO EVIDENCE that the aisle was in fact closed. The store is 24 hours so the products the store sells are 24 hours. Were it an issue of store improvement  as we saw in other aisles  not a problem - but her attitude was vile and not something you want associated with your company. Restocking an aisle happens all day  every day in every supermarket across the world and is not a reason to close an aisle or mock customers.
Hi Tesco   Can you tell me why I don t get clubcard points when I buy formula milk! Why do I get rewarded for buying your lovely food but my poor baby doesn t? 👶🏼🍼

Another bloomin disappointment in Bathgate Tesco!  The problem has stemmed from not having enough white flowers  in particular  roses which has been a thorn in my side for some time.....I usually fall back on lilies but even they were only in pink this evening! Take a leaf out of marks & Spencer s book  nip It in the bud and get it sorted petal 😉

i see you have a customer care department. it s a pity that you don t have a workers care department. the treatment of your workers is more akin to the victorian era than the 21st century . mistakes were made at boardroom level   some of which were alleged to be of a highly dubious nature  costing £milllions and your reaction is to cut your loyal workforces  hours to a minimum. many have been in tears at having to leave as it is impossible for them to survive on the new rotas. shame on you . well i for one will not be using your stores from now on

I m trying to buy something from Tesco direct online and i want to use a gift card. Its asking for a code and a pin i have found the pin and can only assume they want the long number under the bar code as the code. However when i type this in it says it s not valid.

7 items from my favourites somehow ended up in  my order even though i didnt put them in my basket  this isnt the first time either whats going on with your online shopping?  never have that issue with asda and ive done many big shops there

Been trying to use a coupon £6 off when you spend £40 or more online off my grocery shopping and it won t let me redeem this coupon! I ve had to pay now so I don t lose my slot without having the £6 off

What is the point of scan as you go if you get near to the end of your shop and the battery runs out on the scanner!  Update your batteries or get more scanners in to make sure they are always charged up!

I begin with a question: Can you miss what you ve never had?  Watching the latest episode of The Great British Bake Off  I saw the contestants were making Churros. I had never come across these marvels before but as you can imagine my interest had been piqued. Before the credits had even finished I whisked my girlfriend away on the long and treacherous journey to my local Tesco  who I naively assumed would sell these doughy bundles of joy. However  upon arriving at Tesco s  I was horrified to discover that there were none for sale.   After aimlessly wandering around for what seemed like hours  and several arguments with my girlfriend  we settled upon some profiteroles which I usually love but will from now on will be tainted with the disappointment and heartbreak of your lack of Churros.  So to answer my own question  yes you can miss you you have never had.

Hi  I have been to 4 different shops in liverpool looking for your magazine but it seems they are out of stock. Anyone else experiencing problems checking out with online shop? It s telling me too much traffic try later it s said that since 2pm grrrrrrrrrr

I d like to say a huge thank you to Danny at Bradley Stoke Tesco petrol station  he was lovely when my car wouldn t start at the petrol pump yesterday. Massive win for Tesco Gluten Free range! Since I ve been diagnosed  if we fancy a fish and chip night  we buy the gluten free pollack fillets. For some reason we only had 1 left in the pack so I asked my husband if he would like a  normal  one.  He opted for the Birds Eye Gastro Pub Beer Battered Cod and his rating ..... The beer batter was nice but I d rather have had the pollack! The fish was thin and the crumb was poor. Well done Tesco for giving us a product that is as good  if not better  than the major brands

At the weekend I purchased some organic and ripen at home fruit (nectarines and plums)from your Wellington retail park store in Telford. None of the fruit has ripened  it has just turned from rock hard to rotten mush without any in between or edible stage. Sainsbury s manage to supply fresh  ripe fruit which is edible immediately and doesn t go off as it begins to  ripen . Why can t you? Ripen at home is a nonsense  please offer fresh  ready fruit in your stores. I wasted my money on your horrible fruit as I ve only managed to eat one plum  which was a spongy  tasteless mush that I threw away after a couple of bites.

Good evening  whilst sitting at the Barley Mow Stafford  a tesco lorry went past and the door was open....and out fell a box of dairy products  for a lady called Gibson  the driver was going towards Ruegley on the Milford Road!! He didn t see his door open and proceeded up the road!

Coming from a cider brewer  I didn t know you could get such an excellent fade from the apples... with the red dye. Tesco  hod do we go about this? (Completely sarcastic comment  they also tasted like s**t) x

Annual assessment of Tescos Didcot  how did it go? Poorly As usual all crucial items short dated  service with  attitude  at the till  apparently packing is above her.  Another fail  you have a very long way to go Tesco Im off back to any other retailer with an appreciation of customer service and quality food

I would like to know what the point is of having mother and toddler spaces if no-one actually manages it. I go regularly to Tesco in Ely and every single time without fail I see at least 2 cars arrive or leave with no children. I have 3 children including a baby and an autistic teenager and sometimes I have to park far away as the spaces are filled with taxis  work vans and selfish lazy people who don t want to walk  and because nobody does anything about it they will continue. The fact that you have these spaces  why doesn t anyone manage them to make sure the spaces are free for those who actually need them!

Extremely disappointed with Tesco Direct! I bought 2 different items costing over £300  yet the partner companies have no consideration for those who work full time. Would just like to say a massive thank you to the man named Rich working in the toilet roll aisle in Tesco Millbrook this evening  for rescuing my son s favourite teddy  after he threw it in the air  and almost lost behind the freezers. Hi Tesco  I wanted to publicly recognise a member of your team at the Glasgow Silverburn store.  We went in to buy our daughter s 1st mobile phone this morning for her birthday on Saturday and we were served by a lovely young lady called Judy (I think that was her name  apologies if not). She looked after us very well  she was very patient with us and had excellent knowledge of the products. She was on her own in the mobile part of the store and quite a lot of customers were waiting for her attention.  She remained calm  and acknowledged all customers that were waiting immediately and reassured them well  so they didn t feel ignored. She did all this whilst continuing to deal with us and didn t once rush us. She was engaging and genuine and an asset to your team.  Too many people are quick to criticise and slow to recognise so hopefully this will reach Judy to let her know she is doing a fab job X

I bought a packet of Tesco plain tortilla wraps recently and we had them for tea tonight.  There are 4 of us in our family so with a pack of 8 tortilla s I thought great that s two each.  After opening the packet there were only 4 inside instead of the 8 that is printed on the packaging.  Now left a bit hungry with nothing to wrap the rest of our fajita s in.

My 9 year old daughter would like to say a big thank you for the ice cream  free from  range you have done this year. Just wanted to drop a note to say thanks for the fantastic service I received. Sent a message in Facebook to say my sons hudl2 wasn t working. Tesco arranged for it to be picked up repaired and dropped off again. Brilliant service from start to finish. Thanks Tesco.

URGENT - I have a major complaint  could someone please PM me with the name and email address of a Customer Services Manager for the dotcom grocery delivery service?  I was expecting a delivery between 7 and 8pm on Saturday and it didn t arrive. We received no email  text message or email to notify us of the non-delivery. I rang and was told that the van driver hadn t turned up for work and we couldn t pick the order up ourselves because the van was backed up to the doors and nobody could access the shopping (do your vans only have one set of keys each??). It was then re-scheduled for the following day between 12 and 1pm and guess what? It didn t arrive  once again with no notification. Then we got a phone call saying that it was scheduled for 7-8pm that evening. At that point  I told the caller - a van driver - to cancel my order. I asked him if I could speak to the store manager and he said that he wasn t available. This was the Carmarthen store and we were on holiday. We d ordered our shopping to be delivered to our holiday rental because we ve had excellent service from Tesco back at home  but this was absolutely appalling. The first two days of our holiday were ruined by being messed around and still having to go and do our own shopping when we d planned a day out.   This complaint has to go further than a customer services operator  it needs to go to a manager and then further than that if there isn t a proper investigation. I have more details than given above  this is just a summary.

Many thanks to Graham  the awesome home delivery driver who helped me out of a tight spot this morning by unpacking all of my shopping enabling me to stay on an emergency work call.  Thank you so much!

I am becoming increasingly sick of your app messing up my order times  dates and goods.  I rely heavily on online orders as my son has leukaemia and I cannot take him around the shop to purchase my goods.  Several times now it has issues it for the wrong day resulting in me having to have a refund (not back in account straight away) and having to replace it and take another amount from my account.  This not only leaves me short of money for several days but also have to spend time sorting it out with customer service.  No apology has been given on the times I have called either.  Disgusted.  May go to another supermarkets app and see if I have better luck

Have to say that i am really impressed with the grocery home shopping. I have only been using for a short time but all the delivery drivers are really friendly and love the coloured bags as makes un packing a lot easier. Will def be using all the time :-)

I went into your walkden store yesterday  ( 14th September) to buy big milk. When I got to the milk aisle I noticed the milk that was there had the 13th September on the bottles. Had to get a member of staff to bring me some from the back. And to take the out of date milk from the shelves. I feel it s bad enough having normal out of date milk but milk you give to a toddler. I think more action needs to be taken to monitor things for going out of date. I m lucky I checked the date on the bottle before hand otherwise I would of given my toddler the milk without a second thought.

Tesco. I was in your askham bar store yesterday evening getting a few bits and bobs. I m currently following the Slimming World healthy eating plan so was looking at foods I can fit in with that. Walking down your frozen food section I spot the display aid for  healthy foods  so take a walk down there. Well much to my dismay the display card is in the wrong place. The healthy food sign is situated next to ice creams and high fat ready meals oh and pies. Fortunately I was feeling strong yesterday so didn t faulter and buy any of these products but I was very disappointed that your merchandiser hadn t picked this up when moving products around. How many other shoppers in my position will have gone looking for the healthy food and thought  oh it s not here but I ll get a pie and follow it up with ice cream  I have tried to notify your customer service team but seem unable to get a response.
Please can somebody explain how that ridiculous couple in the Tesco TV advert helps promote Tesco? They are not even mildly amusing!
Do you have a hot deli counter for rotisserie chicken?

I m a little annoyed Tescos. I went to your Milton  Cambridge store to pick up my prescription only to find out that last time I picked it up and asked them to re-order it they lost my slip and didn t order it. The pharmacist asked me if I had a card with a collection date on it  I don t because I always pick it up when i m running low. He then tried to excuse the mistake saying that they had 3 new members of staff atm. I don t think that s a good reason for my prescription slip to go AWOL. That s like saying that your care to your customers isn t important because you have new staff. The only staff member that seemed to care was a younger guy with dark hair and glasses. He checked you diary  he kept looking as I walked away  he remembered putting my slip in the re-order basket and confirmed that I had asked you to re-order it as the pharmacist seemed to want to blame me for their mistake. Not cool Tescos :(
I don t understand why you ve started charging for click and collect? Smart move Tesco 🙄🤔

Dear Tesco    I am sure you usually get complaints to this address but I d like to email you with absolute praise! I live in Bethnal Green and I shop at the Tesco Metro on Bethnal Green Road. All the best     Hannah  Beatriz   Marie  and Gonçalo

Just wanted to give you some feedback on great customer service. I ordered a present for my sons birthday via click and collect and went to collect yesterday evening in preparation for his 7th Birthday which is today. On arrival at the Sheldon store I discovered it was closed as it had flooded due to the bad storm we had. There were no staff around to speak to and the doors were locked. After a few phonecalls my husband managed to get in touch with Gav from the store and explained the situation. He located my item and we now have one very happy boy! Sorry I don t have a surname for him but he was so nice and went out of his way to help us so I just wanted to let you know and to pass on our thanks to him.

👍🏾👍🏾 for a full refund on my order today due to faults on both sides

Dear tesco I m very disappointed in your strawberries the last few weeks. Every box I have bought has had a couple of flies in and are very slimey. I got the ones with the best date as the other ones I noticed wer growing mould and fur on. Think strawberries will be off my list in future.

Potatoes were mushy and disgusting.  Family has now had hot dogs for tea instead of cottage pie. Not impressed!!
Thank you tesco for ruining my BBQ. selling the most useless fire lighters iv ever bought. And fire resistant coal that won t stay lit.

Quite disappointed with Tescos clothing online - Ordered my son a pair of grey school trousers  2 blue polo t-shirts  pair of grey school shorts and a pack of 7 grey school socks yesterday. All showing as in stock when i made the order last night. Money has gone from my account. All due for delivery today. So........ i get an email saying socks arnt going to be sent to me  then another email saying the grey shorts arnt going to be sent to me - had an email to say the polo shirts and the trousers had been despatched! Soooo you have my money and i have no school uniform and i dont know whether im getting the trousers or not. Maybe a better system should be used to update the website when things are out of stock!

Some of my friends who know me and my love for pumpkin spice everything  recently sent me a link to a new product available in the UK and specifically in Tesco stores. Would like to say a massive thank you to Sally at the Craigmarloch Cumbernauld store.
