Thank you

Tescos in Rotherham town centre I am not happy with! I walk in for a product that they didn t stock (i was told by a member of staff not eveything online was in store so fair enough) i picked up a similar product but before purchasing I specifically asked what the return policy was.. well the lady on the till had no idea on return policy (why was she on a till?) So she had to ask they guy on self checkout and he says  as long as you have your recipt your fine  the lady on the till then asked me would you like me to open it now to check if the product is correct I said  I can t do the check now but would be back in the hour if it wasn t correct  I leave thinking all is good  well the product turns out wasn t correct it does not work for me so I go back to return (1hour 10min after purchase) now I am told by the self checkout guy the lady on till has gone home and they can only do returns from 8am untill I think 10pm  I wasn t told this when I asked what the return policy was and i specifically said I would be back in the hour so I ask to speak with a manager (night manger shows up) I explain to him what happend and he is sticking to not being able to do returns at this time and that everyone in store knows the return policy but he apologises for lady who served me and says the lady might need more training  my answere to that is  cleary not everyone in store knows the policys because the lady on till had to ask the guy on self service  how can you have sumone operate a till who isn t fully trained? .. after getting no were with him I asked if he could identify the lady who sold me the product so when I do come back i can be sure the lady is told the whole policy on returns so that this does not happen to another customer.. he told me  we only have one till on at this time  and  i could give you her first name only  that was fine by me I said  thats all i want her first name   then all of a sudden he couldn t give me her name as he didn t know who she was?? He then told me  i am not in charge of her  so I asked to speak to sumone who is and he says  there is a boss higher then me  (out comes the real manager) I explained to him the whole situation and he just wasn t intrested atall he looked at the product and said  it s open I wouldn t return that even if it was the right time  then he walks off just like that! How rude!!. Now I am angry/upset with tescos because I was told when i specifically asked what the return policy was that all is good as long as i keep the recipt.. the lady on till was even going to open the product there and then (i wish I said yes now as it would be on cctv the lady opening the item).. i was sold a product that I could return but when come to return I can t!!?? How can tesco do this?? How could any retailer do this??. After being told by the manager (who shouldnt be a manger in my opinion) that he wouldn t return it even if it was the correct time and after more talking with the night manger I ask to speak again with the real manager.. I walk across to the other side of the store to speak with him and he now says  you can try and return it in the morning but I wouldn t do it  since he knows the situation as to why I am here I asked him if it was possible for him to sign my recipt or sumthing so when I do come back at the correct times I can get a refund he says  no I can t do anything like that as he would need to speak to the lady on till  (I m sorry but the lady on the till when she is asked IF she is even asked is probly going to denie anything were she could be penalised) so it becomes my word against hers?  i shouldn t be left out of pocket due to their staffs lack of knowledge on return policys and the giving of wrong information for example i said  it s like that 40 inch tv there being sold to me as a 50 inch tv it is all your staffs fault as to why I am here and have purchased the wrong product  + after being assured I can return the item opened or not that now I cant  they are basically saying that it s my fault for buying the wrong item.. im sorry but no way would I have purchased it if I couldn t return it I would have happily purchased the correct one from your online service.. I am really not happy with this  this is totally wrong of tesco.. so much for every little helps to me it feels like as little information told helps them! Very very disappointed!.

I have just seen a post on your page from Vicki Swan regarding a firefly shopping trolley for people with additional support needs (NOT a disabled trolley). I wonder if it is possible for our local tesco which is Canonmills Edinburgh to invest in one of these. Our son has non verbal autism and a learning disability  he also runs off at every opportunity and has no awareness of danger. We have had to stop taking him for shopping as it s impossible to hold onto him  push a trolley and fill it (even with 2 parents there). Carrying out the weekly shop is an important aspect of daily life which our son is being denied as it s too dangerous for him to attend as we are unable to restrain him. A firefly trolley would help to allow him to be part of this aspect of life so he can learn about the whole aspect of shopping and money 😊 Thank you Tesco - I will look out for one of these trolleys in the future.

let me say something about your Tesco s in Seacroft  Leeds.  night shift Staff seems to be unfriendly and miserable there . Last time I we were there  there was loud club music from a very massive boombox in their bakery section. I get it  its a saturday night and they are missing out on all the fun but it was very distracting and inappropriate. We asked to speak to somebody  a manager but all we got was  oh okay  i ll pass the message  we were so fed up that we just left our shopping trolly on the corner and left..not like we manage to shop a lot with all that noise. safe to say we haven t been back since. tesco   i am not saying your staff are not allowed to have fun and I know fully well how draining it can be to work late nights but I just think that reason is not enough to make your customers suffer by letting them listen to loud  inappropriate  and very distracting clubbing music in a grocery store while they try to shop in peace.  yours sincerely  from a first time mom who just wanted a relaxing shop after a long tiring day

Tesco I would like to know why your vanilla Creme crowns from the bakery section at your Afreton store in Derby DO NOT have any icing on them?! Every other Tesco stores we have had them from are iced  this ruins my weekly shopping order! Please help!!!!!

My 16 year old daughter and her friend went to your Ipswich Copdock store today  looking for L plates. They attend Suffolk One nearby.  They couldn t find any so they stood near the exit with their purchases while my daughter s friend called a mate to ask where she got hers from. While she was on the phone  a young man who works for Tesco was staring at them. He proceeded to speak into his walkie talkie while staring which made my daughter feel uncomfortable. Her friend finished the call and they payed for their drinks. As they went to leave an older female employee was waiting for them. She stopped them telling them the alarm had sounded - which was a lie - and said she would need to search their bags.  She gave a range of ridiculous reasons for looking through their bags from  your headphones may be an issue  to  make up could cause the problem.  They felt intimidated and as if they had no option so let her look in their bags. It was clear the young man earlier had accused them of stealing so she was checking them out. If she had said this to them honestly I wouldn t have an issue but she told bare faced lies and intimidated them. Shame on you Tesco - 2 innocent 16 year old girls made to feel embarrassed and intimidated - shame on you!

Went to your New Milton store today to get a few bits of shopping in. I had my 2 year old nephew  7 year old and 10 month old sons and am 6 months pregnant. As I was looking for a parent and child space  I saw a man get from his car without a child. So I carried on looking to see a van parked in one of those spots. Still looking I saw 2 other cars with people getting in or out without children. I complained to your customer service and they said unfortunately there was nothing they could do  they can t even enforce the disabled spaces. When leaving the store  a man in a sports car pulled up in a parent and child space. When I mentioned he didn t have a child he mimicked my words in a sarcastic voice. Dear Tesco  Please could you explain why you are selling Chicken sourced from Thailand where there are virtually no welfare rights? I notice that your chicken sourced from Thailand is very much cheaper than UK sourced chicken  that surprises me as the transport costs must be very high. Could this be because it s cheaply produced in factory farms where chicken welfare is non existent? Can you tell me if a vet is present during the slaughter process and if Tesco monitors the whole process from hatching to slaughter  if so can you please show evidence of this?  I notice that your British produced chicken meat is clearly labelled  a union flag is displayed prominently on the packaging and it seems you want your consumers to know that it is British. Why do you not label the Thai chicken the same? Is it because the public would be  put off ? After all dog and cat is consumed in Thailand  frequently the cats and dogs are boiled or skinned alive  this does make me wonder about how the chickens are slaughtered.  Please can you explain why you import chicken from Thailand  this can t do your carbon foot print much good.

Im deeply saddened by this and there is a hole in my life shaped like Rayman.

Dear Tesco I use your Hamlet Extra store as it is literally on my door step ( so close I can hear your filling station Tannoy  from my house 😊) Usually my shop takes about 20 mins  recently some higher being. has taken to moving all the items around - leaving all the signage in the old positions. Hi Tesco  whilst I’m glad to see that you have expanded your ‘Free From’ range to include a number of labelled vegan products in recent years  you have many more own-brand products in your stores that contain no animal products but are not labelled as being vegan-friendly. This inconsistent approach can cause confusion as people may think a product that isn’t labelled will be unsuitable for vegans  even if it contains no animal products. I strongly urge you to label all of your own-brand products that are free of animal ingredients and animal exploitation as being suitable for vegans.

Hi tesco   Long time shopper first time poster.  Yesterday I saw something that made me very sad in one of your stores (st rollox  Glasgow).   It isn t the most affluent of areas  and there s a system in place where people have to queue for reduced items  rather than fighting over them  as they are very popular.  As I was paying for my items  I noticed this happening  but what I also noticed was that some the staff were laughing at the situation  in full view if the customers. While it was an unusual situation  I couldn t help but put myself in one of the customers shoes - they can t help being poor  and I know if that had been me  I would have felt embarrassed and belittled. Please remember they are paying customers and people too! Have a word with the staff there maybe?  Acknowledgement of this post would be appreciated greatly.

Dear Mr / Miss / Mrs Tesco s   Very recently you have seen it fit to not only hide most of my usual shopping list in my local store (which I visit daily) after the most random reshuffle  but discontinue various key items as well... is this some kind of attempt to enrich my life by making me hunt for my food  only to find that at the end of the search I need to go to sainburys? It s just my life is already like some kind of sleep deprived episode of the  krypton Factor without throwing in dales super market sweep into the mix  as I m usually dragging round 1 small child and a baby  and it would be great if we could get to the end of the shopping trip without all of us crying... please stop hiding stuff from me  and please can you put back the following items into your central chelmsford store so I can once again enjoy the delights of a successful shopping trip:  Schwarz tuna neopolitana mix  Tesco finest haddock melt in the middle fish cakes (this was my emergency meal replacement for the above  but you d gotten rid of it as well  I lost my mind a little at this point) Sweet cure bacon  Tesco finest goat cheese crisps Leffe brun Leffe nectar  I think there is probably more  but I m too tired to remember at the moment...  I promise to buy it all lots and lots of you do bring them back. Maybe sales of booze had gone down due to my pregnancy? It s OK now though as after obliterating my adult social life by having children I now just sit at home in the evening wistfully lamenting my golden days with a tear in my eye and a glass of leffe  after a fish cake and a cheeky bag of crisps (if I can hide them long enough from my son)  Many thanks  P.s. my son likes the free fruit  and then more tasters when we get to the demonstration station where he gets spoilt rotten.

We bought some steaks from you for a nice couples night in  unfortunately it didnt quite work that way  now let me say first of all i am a good cook and i know i can cook a steak to our liking but its kinda hard to get that when the steak i cook (THE FINEST RANGE) 1 has a piece of grissle going through it that i can only describe as being like a trimming of runner from a car tyre! and the other had a huge chunk of fat/grissle in the centre of it!!! so our nice romantic night in with a steak dinner  all the trimmings a couple fruity ciders  pudding  netflix and some  dessert  possibly on the cards turned into a waste of money (quite a bit at that because it was the  good  stuff we bought) turned into a takeaway from the local chipper costing us more cash and time awaiting it arriving  Dont get me wrong it was OK but was no flipping steak! and dessert was knocked off the cards as we have 2 kids under 4 one of which is at nursery so it was off to bed not to long after the food! anyways i am letting you know this as i am an upset husband angry at the whole thing  as not only did i waste excess moneys but i also wasted what i thought was a good steak  and with no reciept and i didnt have the clubcard we kinda up a creek. so heres to you cheers for that but hey i suppose the cider was nice eh! #wheresthequality #whhaaatttnodessert #idiothusbandforgetsreciept

Hi  this is something my mum has been complaining about for months  both my mum and brother are lactose free  they can only drink goats milk as other options don t agree with them. Our local tescos express has been periodically selling and then removing goats milk from stock. My mum has complained in store and written letters to managers several times before and has received them putting it back in stock just to remove it again! This has happened several times! Surely if they re going to agree to put an item in stock they should keep it in stock? The nearest other place to sell it is a drive away at the next village  hardly a convenience. I d just like to ask if it s possible to put it back in stock and permanently this time?  But must say they did brilliantly with adding more to the free-from range as my mother is also a coeliac :)

I used the loos in your alfreton hall street stores today. Whilst they are mostly clean  the loo roll holders are hanging off   the hand dryers are less than useless and the automatic soap dispensers have been replaced with home brand squirty soap. They ve been like this a fair while and  really let the store down. I m not complaining.  Just bringing it to your attention.

I want to tell you about my experience at your Diss store today. When I got to the till with my large trolley of shopping there was no queue  so I started putting my items straight onto the conveyer belt. The guy on the till said hello and started scanning my items as I was still putting them on the belt the other end. You can imagine the pile of stuff that was waiting for me when I went to go pack.  When I asked him for 5 bags he counted each one  then recounted them a further 2 times before handing them over to me.  The guy didn t really talk to me  he squashed my bread when he scanned it but I waited patiently whilst he took his time  especially when trying to scan the awkward items.  By the time I went to pay I had already worked it out  so I counted out my money with him  which he obviously recounted and then counted my change out two times.  But you know every moment of that was just perfect. I asked him how he was finding the job and he chatted a bit about his experience of Tesco and how they had given him an opportunity many other employers hadn t. See this guy is Autistic. As a mother of a 12 year Autistic boy this makes my heart smile. Changing attitudes teamed with employers  like you  who really do offer equal opportunities are a changing people s lives. So thank you Tesco  it was a pleasure shopping with you today.

My mum tried phoning Tesco pet insurance today and spent 25 mins waiting for someone to answer. She gave up and rang the telephone line for new customers and they answered straight away.  Good customer service for new customers but not for old. Tesco your hopeless.  Now looking for a new pet insurance company.

I am EXTREMELY unhappy with the Tesco Home Delivery. I am a student who does not have access to a car and is staying at a BnB currently. I ordered food to supply me through the end of my placement here to be delivered today at 3pm. By 5pm when my delivery had STILL not arrived  I opened an online help chat as I don t have phone coverage here to make a call. I was told that the driver couldn t find the VERY SPECIFIC address I gave and decided to not deliver. After almost an hour of discussing and explaining and being told this was not Tesco s fault in the slightest  I got the representative to agree to redeliver my order at 6:30pm tonight (I also supplied an additional contact number incase the driver again got lost). It s now 9pm. NO SIGN of any driver  NO PHONE CALL. I now have no food for the evening  no breakfast and no car to drive and get any. I am VERY disappointed with Tesco and their home delivery. At this point  I highly doubt I ll ever give my service to this company again even if it is the more convenient option.

I was shopping in your Harford Bridge Norwich store today and left my purse in my trolley  Thank you to the lovely Human that handed it in. I m very pleased honest people do still exist and I m very happy to have it back. Big thanks

I spent £91 in your Exeter Exe Vale store on Saturday to feed a family of 4 for a week. I don t have time to shop daily so need to buy enough to last the week. Firstly ever fresh item I wanted to buy had a shelf life of 1 or 2 days maximum and lots of it was dated that day but not reduced. Anyway I bought some jacket potatoes for dinner tomorrow night and have just gone to prepare them ready for the slow cooker and they are rotten and stink! I have an important meeting tomorrow night regarding schooling for my daughter so needed a quick tea  but now that has gone out of the window! I normally shop at Aldi and can guarantee their potatoes for about 2 weeks along with fruit. The fruit I bought from your store has gone mouldy already so has gone in the bin along with the potatoes! Looks like I will be going back to Aldi  they might always be busy and rush you through the tills but at least I can buy my food for a week! This really isn t good enough Tesco!!

That is a high price discrepancy that couldn t possibly be explained by  exchange rate  or  VAT !

Can someone explain to me the alcohol policy of Tesco Ireland?   I am a non-european citizen and I tried to buy beer and was asked for an ID. When I showed my driver s license  which is accepted absolutely EVERYWHERE in Ireland  I was informed that I needed to show my passport.   I would like to kindly ask you  attentive attendant that is reading this message right now: do have your passport with you? Also  would you consider Ireland safe enough to bring your passport with you everywhere you go  just in case you want to buy any alcohol from Tesco (because it is the only place who requires such a thing!)?   Seriously. When are companies going to start to think about the customer experience in order to start providing a decent service?  If at least we could hear any justification better than  It is the company s policy   but no... Not even a decent justification is provided.

Hello Tesco   I m writing this whilst awaiting a repairman arranged by yourselves. On August 2nd I purchased a television from a Tesco Extra branch. As I was on holiday at the time  we didn t actually open the box until we returned home at the end of August.  My son  whom the television was bought for  used the set twice with no issues  but when he went to switch the television on for a third time - it wouldn t work. It still doesn t work. Last week I called the number on my receipt and was told that I could return the television to my local branch of Tesco Extra. However  when we returned the boxed television in to store  it became apparent that we had made a wasted journey as Tesco policy is not to exchange brand new televisions that are faulty (not what I was informed on the phone).  Instead  I had to bring the television home again and book an appointment for a repair. I am currently waiting between 9am and 7pm  have had to lose money by taking time off work  and if the repairman cannot fix the television  we have to use more petrol returning it to the store we ve already been to. I m feeling rather disappointed by all of this and don t understand why I couldn t get an exchange as I was told originally on the phone. I m losing out financially here.  Traci.

For anyone interested in the customer service please read my horrible experience and response form Tesco!!! Someone has to stand up to these disgusting people who run local business into the ground and offer the most disgusting service as replacement!!!   Dear Sir/Madam    I am writing to you regarding several incidents that have happened since using Tesco online shopping. I would like to request that I receive a response to this email in due course. I also wish to inform you that  so bad was the service I have received that this might take a while to explain as there are several complaints I am submitting.    After receiving the toaster item above I decided that I wasn’t keen on the style and so decided to return the item. I made a phone call and it was agreed that I could return the item to a store close by to where I work. To my knowledge I was advised to go to Cavendish Street Tesco. Upon my arrival I was greeted and told that they would not be able to refund the cost of the item in that particular store. I contacted the help centre and spoke to a lady who gave me the address for an alternative Tesco on Dean Street. Baring in mind it was my lunch break I proceeded on to the next store. When I arrived at Dean street Tesco I was then told that I was unable to get a refund due to the item being from a third party supplier. I had already been made aware that this was the case but was reassured on my original phone call that the store would take my item. I left the shop with my item still unreturned and as you can imagine rather frustrated. It was 30oc and I was running around London like a headless chicken  I had not  been able to get lunch and I was late back from work due to the situation. I returned to work and again made another phone call and was reassured that the store was in the wrong and that they would have to take the item. I returned to Dean Street Tesco a few days later with the Toaster. The same thing was relayed to me again  I was unable to return the item as the store did not have the facilities to process a refund. Again another lunch break wasted. This had been the third time that I had been to a Tesco store and turned away. I spoke with another Telephone representative who apologetically broke the news  that I had been miss informed not by one of your operators but three different members of your phone operating team told me the same thing. THREE members of your team miss informed me. All calls were logged on the system and so I urge you to listen back to all calls for confirmation of my allegation. The final operator I spoke to offered to give me an email address and contact Clever Box directly but after having wasted so much of my time already I did not see why it was still my responsibility to figure out how to get the item returned. Taking into to account the messing around I think it’s an absolute insult that Tesco did not offer to take full responsibility of the item and arrange to have it collect in the first place. After standing my ground I was offered a £10 compensation refund and an email address to contact clever box on. I’m happy to say Clever box were a lot more responsive to me than the service I had received from Tesco. They were terrified that I had been miss advised so many times and due to the previous  issues offered to except the item free of charge. They basically took the responsibility for the mistakes made by Tesco. You’ll learn this is not the first time Tesco have failed to take responsibility if you read on.     Incident No 2   28/08/2016   For some reason my Club Card attached to my account has not been updated. I made a phone on the 28/08/2016  and spoke to a representative. After being left on hold for some time I was told that I would receive a phone call back once the issue had been looked into… I’m still waiting for my club card points to be updated and I still haven’t received a phone call.       Date: Wednesday 31stth Aug 2016   Ref : 21000635   At 21.10  I received a text to say that my home delivery had been delayed and that I should expect for it to arrive between 21:00 and 23:55. I spoke to a representative that confirmed that the driver had been delayed and would be late. I was also made aware that it’s against company policy to have vehicles on residential roads after 11pm. I was also informed that if I wanted to reschedule the delivery for the following day I would be recharged for the home delivery and also the shopping. I appreciate this would’ve been refunded at a later date  but I would like to know why the responsibility of  something so beyond my control would then be put back on to me? We’re not discussing a £20 shopping bill but a little under £100 bill which I was going to be charged twice for until a refund was given. I was offered a £5 voucher as a sorry and was thanked for my patience. Now I’d like for someone to put themselves in my shoes. It’s an insult to be offered £5 when your delivery driver turns up at the front at 11:45pm. I can’t actually believe that that’s the best you had to offer. As if it’s acceptable to have someone waiting up until that time. Now I’d like to make a few points. I wouldn’t get out of bed for £5. The very foundations of our society are partly based on  presentation  punctuality and reliability and I have been failed on all three  at every point of contact during all my experiences. I actually had a phone call from the store manager who called to apologise but then proceeded to ask me if I know why the delivery driver was late? Why on earth would he be asking me? Surely the professional thing to do would’ve been to gather his information before making a phone call of apology to me. It came across like he didn’t know what he was apologising for.     I suppose you would like to know what I would like the outcome of this complaint to be. Quite frankly I’m not sure why I should have to pay for shopping that not only arrived late but broke your rules and regulations. There is no excuse for calling someone’s doorbell at that hour especially when the lady below is an elderly and very easily confused.   Please note that if I don’t get a response I will not be suing Tesco services again as I’m going to need something to rebuild my trust in a brand that has shown no sign of organisation or punctuality or respect for me. I think it’s an absolute shame that the lack of communication and customer awareness is letting the brand.     I look forward to hearing your response    Yours Sincerely

Your customer service is atrocious on Tuesday the 30th of August  I brought a pasta pot for my 3 yr old daughter only for her to discover a stick (or as your store put it a foreign object) in her pasta mid way through i see you saying how did she find that we ll that will be by nearly choking on it!!!!! so I took it back to the store to be told that i would get a call off head office within 24 hours and would you believe it s the 12th of September now an after 5 visits to your store to see what s going on as still not had an apology or my phone call from head office so off i go to tesco again this mornin to try an find out what is going on  tesco I d like to know!

Dear Tesco  I do hope my post doesn t get lost in amongst the many many complaints you get here (mainly from people upset that they found a creature in their fresh veg  I d call getting a free Pet a bonus but hey ho) ... I ordered some Safari Park tickets using my clubcard points and they re now emailed to you instead of posted (which is great!) But the email had gone adrift in my Spam folder and been automatically deleted so myself and family were sat here  picnic at the ready with no tickets. I m a mother to 2 toddlers and yesterday I visited your widnes store at 2.30pm and again at 7.30pm and both times I was unable to park in the child section. The first time  the last space was taken by the car in front and there were no children  just overweight women and the second time I watched 3 separate cars park up with only adults in. At the same time that I watched these selfish individuals take child spaces  I watched 2 other families have to park in the section with the normal small spaces. If you are not going to fine these individuals for abusing the spaces  can you change the layout of your carpark? I need to use the wider spaces to open the car doors to get my children out of their car seats and I would be more than happy to park in the child spaces if they were at the back of your car park. I am more often than not parked at the back of your car park  in the hopes that other people will not park too close. I have also visited another store and found the child spaces were on the outskirts of the car park  this seems a much better lay out. To be honest though  yesterday s experience has put me off shopping at your stores. I m going to spend my money elsewhere in future  but I do hope you will improve your car park and make it more family friendly for other young families.

WOW!! I had to write this morning to say what an AWESOME company you are. I m only out of hospital after a back procedure  and very sore  so any kind of lifting is out  never mind a family shop for lots of pets with heavy food and liter etc. I never knew you guys did an online delivery service until a friend suggested it. Not only did I get everything I needed delivered to my door in less 24 hours  but you had everything I usually buy all ready for me to chose again on the page  so it was completely hassle free. It s made my life a LOT easier this week I can tell you  and your delivery gentleman John  was an absolute pleasure to deal with! Thank you so much for providing this service  it must be such an ease to the elderly  sick  disabled or very busy people! An absolute breeze to do! Will recommend you guys to everyone and will be getting this for my grandmother too! Thanks again!

Yet again Tesco you surprise me and not in a good way!   After speaking with your tech support team it was organised that my sons hudl 2 would be sent back to them for repair after a software update left it unusable. This was a lovely gesture on your part as its out of warranty and you fixed it free of charge for which I am grateful and I thank you. But..... And here s the surprising but.... Though you have rectified the software problem and sent it back to us looking shiny and new it now doesn t charge  I mean at all!!! The charger gets plugged in (and we ve tried three chargers) and nothing happens. We discovered this last night when we tried to charge it for the first time since it came back to us last Tuesday (06/09/2016)!! I ve called and spoken to a nice man at your Tech helpline today only to be told that you won t fix it again  even though it s come back to us this way!! You ve said we MAY be eligible for a partial refund of the item at today s value (which lets be honest will be nothing as it was bought almost two years ago and you no longer sell the hudl 2). I just hoped you would take responsibility for this error and fix the problem you created so that my 5 year old can play with his tablet again. Surely this is a reasonable request?!? We get to have a five year old with a working tablet and you get to keep your money and our custom.

As a mother with a young baby I wrote a post on babies babies babies Facebook group about my recent trip to Tescos   where I witnessed two people parking in the baby and child bays without children.   Both of these instances were witnessed by one of your members of staff which my husband asked to help enforce this rule and was reluctant to do anything . This is what I would call bad customer service. Even if it is not his job to police the car park   surely if he is in a uniform representing your company we should get more than a few grumbles from him .   Angered from what I saw ( a mixture of people parking there without children and how this effects other mums ability to shop in your store . Without these spaces we cannot get children in and out of the car .. It s not possible ) as well as your staffs inability to do anything to help I shared this experience with a group called Babies Babies Babies and to my dismay the response I got sharing other similar stories in your carparks across the country came forward .   In fact some of these stories were worse with customers seeing your own staff park in these spaces without any children.   Tescos was dubbed the worst for instances with these spaces .   I am therefore writing because all these stories are ridiculous. Your rules aren t being reinforced and parents with young babies are paying the price.   I would like to know what you are going to be doing to fix this issue .   An idea I had was that if you parked in this space you would have to register your license plate with customer service so they could see you had a baby and actually needed the space .   I look forward to hearing from you soon .

Hey guys! Just a feedback/fix request after a shop yesterday  here. :-)    I popped in to my local store yesterday evening to pick up a few things for the weekend and used Scan-As-You-Shop (SAYS) as per usual. Scanned the end of trip barcode on the checkout to have my shop loaded into the till  then went to payment and redeemed/inserted a bunch of close-to-expiry Clubcard vouchers I needed to use up or lose.  It was only then that I noticed the checkout I was using didn t have a [Cash] option on the payment screen  and it became apparent to me the checkout was operating in cashless mode. I paid the balance by card instead  but this was a minor inconvenience given that for once in my life I was in possession of just the right amount of change! :-D :-p    Could the SAYS till software please be revised to make supported and unavailable payment options visible and clear to the customer at a point *before* they scan the EoT barcode  please? With classic self-scan this is less of a problem as I can easily carry my goods over to another checkout if I see the one I m about to use displaying a [Start Cards Only] button  but as SAYS downloads the cart from the scanner to the till and then resets the scanner this is considerably more difficult to do on a SAYS checkout without requiring staff assistance.   I d suggest having an info-strip along the top of the screen (Like those displayed by credit card terminals) showing payment options accepted  with a visible cross over those which are temporarily unavailable. This is more likely to be noticed by customers whilst aiming their scanners at the EoT barcode on the top of the monitor. :-)    Many thanks for your consideration! 8-)

Dear Tesco    Its with deep heartache I have to write this.   Me and my Partner have used the scan as you shop a few times now and each time we have to under go a random  security  check!  I understand that as a store you have a right to do this  but we have used it 7 times now and each time we have had these checks.  When I said something to a lady in store about this she said it was because we are only 20 and they do this to all young people. I don t feel this is acceptable from a company to discriminate against us because of our age!!  We also have under gone comments from other customers like  oh look the young ones are stealing again   oh they must have no shame sealing like that   I must stress that I suffer really bad from depression and anxiety and the scan as you shop was brilliant for me to help reduce my anxiety levels  how ever this is not the case.   I must also stress we have never used a Tesco since the incident with the lady confirming that Tesco discriminate against young people.  I also plan on never using a Tesco again and have moved to another super market.   Hope to hear from you soon. Mr K Silkstone.

Tesco Tesco Tesco....I applaud you being forward in trends and marketing however we literally have just got children back after their summer leave  it s only the start of September with an Indian summer predicted  September weekend still to go along with Halloween and Guy Fawkes and you have CHRISTMAS confectionery out! Tesco Extra Yeovil. Worst family experience ever. Ordered a breakfast and 2 children s fish fingers and chips at 11:58  told fish fingers were on afternoon menu. Explained OK  I ll order separately  Ordered breakfast waited 2 minutes then ordered children s meals. Told children s meals would be 25 minutes. Didn t want children to wait so said just two beans on toast instead. Told that was breakfast menu that ended at 12 (2 minutes ago when the breakfast was ordered) Very frustrated I asked for all the food to come at once when the children s meals were ready. Was told OK. Breakfast came out 15 minutes later  children s meals took another 15 minutes  Couldn t eat the breakfast in front of them  so had to let it go cold. Asked to see a manager and was told that no manager was in. I returned 4 days later and again no manager on site  I spoke to the store duty manager who took my details and said he would pass details on for a call back. (I watched him enter cafe and give info to counter staff) it s been another 4 days and I ve still herd nothing. Starting to think the extra in the store name means extra hassle. I will never go to either the cafe or supermarket again and will tell everyone that is interested about the poor attitude and service of TESCO  ASDA can have my business from now on.

Hi Tesco  bit of a random request.... I was in the Reading store on Napier Road this evening  just before 8pm. As seen on Morrison s fb page.  Dear Morrison s   After 6 1/2 years of loyal service my Tesco microwave went to electrical goods heaven. A short service was had followed by an emotional trip to the tip.   This morning I felt ready to embrace the relationship with a new microwave. I was in your Southend store shopping and spotted at the reasonable price of £40.   After purchasing said microwave I headed home to fill the void left by my Tesco one. After opening the box I was dismayed to find that the lead supplied did not reach to the plug socket. A mere 15cm stood between me and microwave heaven.   After nearly ripping out my entire kitchen and starting over   I came to the conclusion that an extension lead would suffice for now.   At last I have a working microwave but I am disappointed that Morrison s are cutting corners   or in this case cables to cut costs.   Regards  Andy

*Tesco Roborough Plymouth* At approximately 11am this morning I visited the above named store with my 2 daughters (aged 2 and 1). My 1 year old was in her stroller and 2 year old on her reins. Something must have caught my 2 year old eyes and within 10 minutes of being in the store her reins slipped out my hand and she ran.... My heart sank and within seconds she was out of my sight! I called out for her and there was no answer. Dashing around looking for her on my own wasn t working so I alerted a member of staff. All staff involved acted so fast and before I knew it there were so many staff looking for my daughter. What seemed like forever was probably about 5 minutes but they found her 😃 At this point I m in tears and still feel sick. But the staff were there for me and both my daughters. I would like to thank each and every one of you for ending a parents worst nightmare. A special mention has to go to a man named Paul who went the extra mile to help with my shopping at the checkout whilst giving the girls sweets and making them smile. He then carried my shopping to the car! Amazing customer service and being a dad to 4 himself he knew what I was going through. THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH from a very happy tesco customer. ☺

EVERY LITTLE HELPS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! sat at home watching the manchester derby with some beer which scanned thru the till half the price advertised on the shelf and your web site must say it tastes much better when it even cheaper than at aldi where i normally go for my booze thankyou mr tescos lol

I just want to say a huge thankyou to one of your members of staff who helped our ambulance crew with a critically ill patient. She was absolutely fantastic and took time out of her personal time to help someone in need. Her help was truly appreciated.

Dear Tesco  Just a quick note to demand the 20 minutes of my life back that I just lost in my local store.  I thought I had become well accustomed to some of your product peccadilloes and foibles (such as cream being foisted from its rightful place among the dairy and milk products)   but this morning my ghast was utterly and completely flabbered by an impromptu and increasingly frantic search for tinned tomatoes.  I must admit that this may be down to hubris on my part; there may have been a little self assured smugness as I entered the store  confidently telling myself that I had the matter well in hand - my quarry would be safely tucked alongside the baked beans and other tinned vegetables.  Imagine the Bean-esque dumbfounded expression that settled on my face when I arrived at that particular destination to find that no  there were no tinned tomatoes there!! Up and down the aisle I paced  at an increasingly slowed pace. It seemed obvious that I just couldn t see them. Alas  this was not the case. Remembering the cream stocking policy  I tried to apply the same warped logic.   THAT S IT!  I thought  they ve stocked them round by the pasta sauces! . I jubilantly strode into the next aisle only to be presented with a complete re-run of the previous scene in its entirety. I was now beginning to doubt my own mental competence as I looped the two aisles over and over  stooped to varying heights with each pass; this is surely the early onset of some kind of dementia I convinced myself.  Tomato blindness is obviously just the first in a devastating and degenerative array of symptoms that were now queuing up to beset me. Just to confirm this I had to prove that there were no tinned tomatoes present elsewhere in the store   after all   where else could they possibly be?  A few aisles across and my jaw dropped to the floor (or  for the sake of accuracy   just above the floor about level with the display of cooking salt in various packages).  I HAD FOUND THE TINNED TOMATOES!!  It turned out that  in their wisdom   Tesco have now stocked their tinned tomatoes   puree etc. in a new and convenient food category entitled  Tomatoes And Pulses . TOMATOES AND PULSES!!?  WHAT THE HELL IS THAT!? Why stop there?  Why not  Strawberries And Toilet Duck    Cabbages and Stationery  or even  Sausages And Birth Control ?  Please at least try and exercise some common sense in your store policies!
Standing at the make up shelves which are locked. Been waiting 10 minutes after ringing the bell 8 times for someone to open them so I can spend some money in your store????? Ashford

The issue I m having doesn t directly relate to the online website. Have you tried putting £116 worth of shopping through a self service till? Yeah I think you can imagine what it was like  Fuming wasnt the word. So we managed to put the shopping through to then get my privilege card out for it to say staff discount not aloud...asked the same member of staff to please help his name was Ekram to try my card again and again which didn t change anything for him to then just shrug his shoulders at us and go help somebody else and ignore us so i said is there nothing you can do? Do I not get my discount then? for him to reply  Erm no sorry  and just walked away!! Absolutely disgusted with the whole experience and customer service I received and I work for One stop stores who are part of tesco so Iam even more annoyed as being a customer and  part of the tesco family I feel really let down as I would never have treated a customer like that at all especially if they spent nearly £120. He could see we was struggling and didn t seem bothered or interested and to not give me my discount which worked out at £11 which Iam entitled to just left me feeling stupid and embarrassed the way he handled it and to not shout a manager over or someone who could help....I will be contacting customer services tomorrow to make a complaint about this person to say he is representing tesco I would not want him working for me  no people skills at all and to dismiss us and help someone else in the middle of helping us and then come back to his post and just stand there and pretend we wasn t there was shocking. Anyway I expect a reply and some kind of apology and I will not be returning to that store again.

I am furious with your Norham Road store in North Shields!  I came to shop just before 5pm with my two children and was greeted by a lady doing an Oreo s promotion.  She told my children to buy some Oreo s and they would get a gift bag with new Oreo flavours to try.  We went and purchased some regular Oreo s and the kids were quite excited about it.  Now this is a little thing  but to my kids it meant the world.  So we went shopping for roughly ten minutes and came back to where the lady was only to find she had packed up and left!  Why on earth would she not have the common decency to tell us if she was about to finish or go on a break?  Why did she feel it was OK to let two children down over something so trivial?  I wouldn t be so offended and upset had she explained she was due to finish  but she didn t and as such I left with two upset and angry children.  Thanks VERY much!

Dear Tesco  this evening I received my delivery of various items  including some honey...... I have tried many various brands and some are more expensive  more flavourful etc. than others. As I use it in my cooking  I don t need it to be fantastic  though I still appreciate an actual taste of honey! which leads me to my complaint.   I decided to try 2 different jars - your Everyday Value and  the next one up  that you sell  Tesco Clear Honey  Both state that they contain a blend of EU and non-EU honeys.   Without any actual evidence to back up my taste buds  I can t say with absolute certainty that the  Value  is more golden syrup than Honey  but they sure try to tell me this! It does not even smell of Honey. Your  Clear Honey  did have a smell of the actual product and some flavour  but not 100%  This issue has previously been highlighted by news programmes  aired on one of the main channels  so I know I m not out with the fairies. The conclusion was  after analysing several brands (not saying Tesco was one of them) that many many many of them claiming to be honey  were in fact blended  to varying degrees  with golden syrup or similar.   I notice that the jar does not say  Ingredients  - then Honey - it simply says Honey... So either this is Tesco covering themselves by  not listing any other  ingredients  or Tesco perhaps needs to quality control their imported honey or research the import sources more thoroughly. This is one product which (in my opinion) should not be sold as honey.  I would be very interested in finding out what the actual situation is and I would be happy to send you a sample of the contents of my jar  in for analysis if required  though I very much believe this to be unnecessary.   The £1 I spent on this  product   has not persuaded me to purchase it again.  Regards Maria Parrott

Dear Tesco! Tried to find a way how to contact your complaint car insurance page  but  it is made impossible  so  I am writing here. If I don t get the reply soon  I will be forced to use other social media to try to fix the problem that my family and I are going threw. So  we bought Tesco car insurance  because  we trust your company and already are your regular customers. My husband is very sensitive driver and never had to make any claim. But recently somebody crushed into our car in residential area and run (no cctv cameras). We had to claim from our insurance to fix the damage. The way we have been treated is disgusting. We didn t even have right to get normal rental car. Instead  we got coutosy car that smells like cigarettes  dogs  cats and there are buggies wiped on the inside of the car. We made complaint and they did get it washed but not the way it should be. Only windows and vacuum cleaned. Buggies are still there as well as smell. There is also dog bites inside of the car and gears do not work properly. But we still cannot get normal courtesy car  because the person who damaged it run away. Why are we punished?! To make things harder  we have small child and I am in my last stage of pregnancy. Stressed 24/7 and scared to be driven to the hospital in it in case it dies on the road while I am in labour. I am scared to bring my newborn baby from hospital in case that she get some infection from the car because newborn babies immune system is not developed yet.  It makes me sick in my stomach the way your insurance is treating us. We feel anything but insured  covered and safe. Very bad customer service! Hope you fix that soon. Sara Shannon

Ordered Sunday money taken out and confirmation sent for delivery yesterday between 8-10pm  I have been away all week with work and these bottles are for my husbands 40th birthday party TOMORROW.  I ring at 10.50 to find out if they were turning up  keep me holding for 10 mins eventually I put it down and call on my landline because of the cost.  It tells me they are now closed!  I call first thing this morning kept waiting 10 minutes and then told the shop didn t get the order and can t deliver today maybe on Saturday - I pointed out if it doesn t turn up on Saturday - I was be in a real mess.  Offered no other solution than to cancel my order - honestly - I am a first time customer   don t you want me to return? I am so angry don t offer a service that is suppose to make life easier if you can t fulfil that obligation.  If any one asked for a recommendation I would have to tell them not to use you to by wine delivery service.

Tesco - I have a lovely story to share with you. This time last year I was a brand new mum. I d had a pretty traumatic birth and had a particularly miserable baby girl  who cried a lot and I was very tired and stressed. In the 6 weeks following her birth I hadn t been out with her on my own  so when my husband went back to work I made the decision to venture inti town and go to Tesco to get some groceries. It was a hard journey for me  I was very anxious and tired and just when I was nearly done shopping my daughter started screaming in her pram. I was so hot and bothered and flustered and I very nearly just dropped my basket and left when an angel appeared and helped me. The assistant stopped what she was doing and commented on how lovely my daughter was  asked me if I had found anything I needed  and escorted me to the till where she rocked my baby in her pram while I paid for my shopping. She was completely amazing - if it wasn t for her my confidence would have been totally rocked and I don t know I would have had the guts to go out alone with my baby again if it hadn t been for her help. Anyway! I told everyone I know how kind this member is staff was but in my flustered moment I never caught her name. The other day while filling up in the petrol station I saw her!! I asked if she remembered me and she said yes  I told her my daughter is 1 now and I thanked her so much. To some it may seem like such a small thing she did for me but I was just so grateful it made such a huge difference to me. I told her I would give her some positive feedback so here it is: Jennie @ Stafford Tescos  you deserve some love for being so lovely  happy  helpful and caring. Thank you for helping out this mummy when she needed a kind word and some gentle support.  ❤️

Disappointed in Tesco s customer service tonight. I finished work at 1AM  and decided that I d like to go buy some pizza and garlic bread from Tesco to have as my dinner.     After driving from Central Milton Keynes to the Tesco in Kingston  I quickly made my selection and placed my items on the belt  only for the person on the till to ask the customers in front of me to close the gate behind them and informed me that it was self serve only.     Taken aback  I decided to leave my items there and select a different store whose dedication to customer relations is a lot stronger. Thank you to your employee who lost you a customer as I shall not be shopping at Tesco again  and will take my business elsewhere.     Sincerely  Tesco Ex-Customer

I would just like to acknowledge a fantastic worker you have at your Tesco in Midsomer Norton. This evening at about 7pm I went to Tesco with my 3 month old baby. As I carried him across to the trolley area  a young man of about 18 working as a trolley collector saw me coming and immediately moved a twin baby trolley out of the way and took the single one out and brought it over to me and then held it steady while I strapped my baby in. I wish I d looked at his name badge such a thoughtful man really going the extra mile! He did this before I d even noticed that the twin one was in the way. I have several times before had to negotiate moving trolleys in and out in order to get to the one I needed while holding my baby and shopping bags. I hope you can make this man an example of what good customer service really is and help your other employees be so helpful!

Hi there Tesco.   I m involved in a community event this Monday 12th September in Ilford  Essex. We are a group of volunteers organising a free meal and small gifts for families who are underprivileged in celebration of Eid. We are working on a referral only basis in conjuction with local women s refuges and food banks. We have been really lucky so far and have managed to source a hall and some local restaurants who are providing food free of charge. However we are struggling to get hold of other items such as disposable plates  cups and cutlery. We would also like to source some flowers for women who have fled domestic violence and small gifts for the children. We also need some drinks  serviettes  black bin bags and baby wipes. I ve contacted my local superstore in Goodmayes and they provided me with an email address to put my request in writing  but it s been 2 days now and I ve not had a reply. With the event only a few days away I m starting to panic a little as we still need so much. Is there anything you can do to help us please? I know that Tesco actively support community events and we would love to have you guys on board  we are excited by this event and any support or donations would be greatly appreciated. Please do get in contact with me at your earliest convenience. Thank you for your consideration of this request :)

I ve just posted this on my local breastfeeding group page and thought I should let you know too  If you re ever concerned about shopping and feeding baby at the same time go to tesco at chester le Street.   Just got home from there. Half way round penny (3.5 months) wanted a feed so I lugged her out of seat and started pushing while feeding. Lots of people chatted to me and said how well I was doing and how lovely it was to see. A big muscley guy buying energy drinks even smiled and said  got your hands full there  then the manager came over and said  do you want someone to push your trolley for you?  Was SO nice! I didn t take them up on it (I think it would have led to a screaming fit from my toddler and I was managing ok [I m used to walking and feeding]) but it was so nice. It was such a lovely shopping experience.  and lots of things on offer!! Persil non bio powder  (45 washes) £5.50 down from £11! I ve NEVER seen it that cheap anywhere!  I ll have a spring in my step all day after that... little things :)

Hi I visited a large tesco store in lincoln this evening to purchase a gift for a friend s new baby. As they don t live nearby I asked at the till for a gift receipt and was told to go to customer services. You can imagine my surprise when  I asked this same question at customer services to be advised you don t issue gift receipts. When I explained that the items were a present I was told that I would still have the receipt so it wouldnt be a problem.  The issue is how many people send a gift to a friend 500 miles away with the receipt so they can see how much they have spent. I found that suggestion a little odd and was frankly suprised you don t offer gift receipts.  I promptly left without any of the shopping i went in for and will no longer shop in your stores for gifts for friends.

So today I decided to take my sister to your shop  she s starting her apprenticeship next week and is all excited. I recommended your shop as it s cheap and especially good on back to school items. We got there and found exactly what she needed for an absolute bargain price which was great. I then thought I ll do a few bits of shopping for myself and thought to pick up a few bottles of cider for my dad as it was on offer and I had my ID with me and thought I d treat him! So we went to the check out  my sister used the self scan quickly for the shorter queue whilst I waited in line as I knew I would probably be Asked for ID. My sister waited on a bench for me to finish. So as the lady started putting my things through she then came to the beer and asked for ID (absolutely fine which I expected her too) so I got out my driving license for ID and asked for a bag and then to my absolute amazement  she rudely pointed to my sister and very nastily said to me  Has she got ID too  now i know shops have to be strict on ID which is absolutely fine but let s just remember It s ME at the check out  ME buying the items  ME paying for it and ME with the ID. No of course my 16 year old sister who ISNT buying the alcohol doesn t have ID why would she need it for buying back to school items????? The lady then refused to give me the alcohol. I m sorry but I didn t know the law was you have to be 18 along with everyone else with you!!!!!!! Say if my sister was 5 years old would you still ask the 5 year old for ID??? NO you wouldn t. Say if I was a young mom and she was my daughter would I not be able to shop for beer with her just cause she wouldn t have ID???? I m sorry but I am very disgusted after my trip and will not be returning again!!! At the end of the day I was buying the alcohol and I had the correct ID so why was i not allowed to have it????

I use Tesco home delivery for my groceries because I am disabled.  Mostly I am happy with the quality and service  BUT there are somethings that could be better.  You have fishmonger counters where there should be TRAINED operatives.  Request a trout cleaned and scaled well you get one opened from the jaw to the tail  the gills are not removed  the guts are gone but the blood line is not removed from the backbone  and obviously someone has scraped a knife in a strip down the side of the fish leaving 99% of the scales still on the fish. This week I ordered Salmon Side  now whilst the fish had been filleted well and the pin bones removed  the skin was not touched leaving all the scales for me to remove.  I have in the past cleaned and filleted Salmon  the first thing that should be done is to remove the scales  it makes the removal of the skin easier!  It also means if the salmon is to be served with the skin then the diner does not have inedible skin.  I think it would be a good idea if the Fishmongers were to have at least 1 day at a local catering college where they could be introduced to the basics of cleaning scaling and filleting fish.
Thanks to tesco for sending a  hot  delivery driver from Martlesham today! I had 2 extra helpers to unload today my teenage girls all of a sudden wanted to help! 😂😂🙌🙌
Hi there  can you clarify when the baby event starts please?

Hi Tesco  just to say  thank you so much  for your wonderful free from products of Fruit Splits  Cones  Choc Sticks and for also stocking the range of Swedish Glace. Hopefully there will be a range of desserts like these in popular eating places someday......until then I can enjoy my desserts at home. I love the free from smoked cheese too....lovely with some spicy salami  onion and then grilled.  Thank you!  :)

It is now in a split tray  the film lid won t peel off evenly to stir at the half way point  there are now no whole green beans but flecks of green and the rice was beyond sticky as it was completely clotted in a lump. I imagine you guys get a fair amount of flack but I just wanted to balance it out with some positive feedback 😀🎂🍰 Thank you again.

Dear Tesco   I have been a loyal shopper for many years and for the last few years   I have used your delivery service quite happily ( your drivers are always so helpful)  and although my health is not spectacular being able to order and have items delivered has helped me maintain my independence   That being said I opened the app on my phone as usual today   ready to start my order for delivery next week   and I had no issue with the £40 minimum spend   however whoever though that fiddling with how you actually book   needs a stern talking to!   I have just tried for over 20 minutes to checkout! The new system that seems to have appeared is complicated and rather irritating!   every little helps...  is a phrase I live by   I don t have alot of money   so booking a 1hr slot for a set price suited needs just fine   upon realising your NEW flexible feature I tried to book several times without success ( and constantly being bounced back to the home screen)  once I gave up and just paid a higher delivery ( still took several attempts)  all was well.... So I thought   Now I usually  screen shot  the confirmation page   just to remind myself... Only for my phone to inform me that the  page is protected  and I can no longer save that image   Please   stop playing around with things that work perfectly well ( and consider speaking with your app development department... If it works   leave it alone!)    Kind regards Yvonne   Ps I m rather miffed about all this!

So as we all know  our children have all gone back to School now! However not everyone goes back at the same time. For example  my 4 year old daughter is starting her first year of school this year. Her first full-time start date is the 19th September  with some other children opting into starting a little later. I decided I would buy her uniform much closer to her start date (because they grow so fast!). And after we had had her teacher visit her at home. I knew Tesco were selling some basic school clothes so I planned on heading there. Only just a week ago I saw the uniform all up on display  but today was a different story! I started to panic wondering where I would now get her uniform from. I don t drive and I am out of work so my options were limited. I frantically looked around for a member of staff and asked if by any chance you still had some of the stock outback. Luckily  a kind gentleman named Martin had over heard my conversation with another staff member and didn t hesitate to help me. He took me and my two children (I also have a 9 month old baby) outback and spent a good amount of his time making sure I had what I needed for my daughter to start school. He did a lot more than I would ever expect from a staff member and I wanted to make sure he was given some positive feedback for his efforts. I now have one happy 4 year old set and ready for her first day of school! Thank you #Martin from Whiteley Tescos. :) I also wanted to suggest to Tescos that maybe keeping some of the school stock out a little longer would be a consideration?

I am disgusted when I compare Tesco online banking with the other UK and Chinese banks we use. Tesco actually suggest  no  request  that we use social media  Facebook  Twitter  believe it or not! If you happen to be in a country where these are banned  China?  then bad luck  you must pay £10-15 per minute to call them  IF you happen have your UK SIM card with you when most people use local SIM cards. Local SIM cards don t allow international calls (unless you want to waste money)  hotels don t allow international calls in some countries because of the cost. So  really  you are out of luck UNLESS  you want to spend money getting a VPN so you CAN use social media AND want to spend days of your holiday/travels  conversing via social media with 12 hour delayed replies each way. Tesco bank  get up to date!

Hi Tesco   I am a online shopper with TESCO. More than a year. Recently  On 2nd Sept   I bought RM129.98. And when the deliveryman sent goods to my house  there was a small portion  SAVE RM5 when you spend RM50 . attached below of the tax invoice.  Today  I spent another RM 153.30  i got the same amount of e-coupon RM 5.  Can you explain the statement  save rm5 when spend rm50 ? From my understanding  if i spend rm153.30  means i get rm5x3 .  I called Customer Service  she also was a bit  confused when giving explanation to me.  If customer only get RM5 coupon regardless the total of e-purchase..then you SHOULDNT write  Save rm5 when you spend rm50 ..  Just put  Save rm5 for spending rm50 and ABOVE  OR   With min e-purchase of RM 50 and above  you will save rm5   If I know it earlier  I will just split up my transaction from RM 153.30 to 3 transactions of each RM 50+.   Every customers are entitled for unlimited times of coupon RM5..right?  Bit dissapointed as tesco customer.  2nd inquiry : I never receive any email confirmation of my shopping list.  When you submit your items list   there is a message  an email confirmation will be sent to your email .  How is this happened?  Pls give me an explanation..Thank you

I received a text from 60077.  “ FreeMsg Reminder: U are subscribed to the PrizeHook Gift Cards competition & £250k Draw for £4.50 per week until you send STOP to 60077. Help? 03301340183. “ I checked my mobile phone balance and saw £4.50 has been taken. I only topped up yesterday so I could see straight away how much was missing. I rang Tesco Mobile on 0345 301 4455 and after navigating through the various options I spoke to someone who said there was nothing they could do and advised me to call the number supplied in the Scam Text message. I was reluctant to make any contact with a company that just robbed me but he insisted that was the only course of action I could take. I called the number 03301340183 and listened to a recorded (seemed very unprofessional) message asking me to press 1 to stop further messages if using the actual phone or 2 if it was for another phone and to enter that number. I got a text a few minutes later to confirm: All competition entries on this shortcode are now cancelled. No further messages will be sent. Any queries  just call Customer Services: 03301340183.

So disappointing in Tescos today.  Signed up for their payqwiq app.  First time I used it on self check out thought yes this is going to be so quick. Put all my stuff through scan my phone. What could be easier. Stays frozen on processing. I call the assistant over she messes with the till roll nothing. She calls the manager messes with the till roll nothing so she says I m sorry I ll have to print your receipt from the main computer.  10 mins later sheet of paper with my transaction on it.  Not such a quick system but I think ok first time these things happen.  Yesterday I return do exactly the same when I scan my phone it freezes on processing. Again various people come and mess with the till roll.  The managers says I ll print it from the main computer. Comes back 10 mins later says sorry I can t. I tell her I m not happy with out the receipt to tell me my transaction is complete.  My transaction could not be refunded because the till was still processing.  Eventually she said I ll get such a such he knows all about this system well along came such and such. Did exactly the same as everyone else with the same result. This was over an hour and I had to leave a very dissatisfied customer.  So later I ring customer services.  I tell my story the operator speaks to various people comes back and says were very sorry it happened.  That s really not enough there was no reassurance that this would be rectified.  I asked from the beginning for it to be raised as a complaint.  But no a sorry and what else do you want me to do madam is what I got. When I said I wanted my complaint raised and I wanted to know the out come he said sorry madame Tesco can not help you i will have to transfer you to the company that runs payqwiq and their very busy so you ll have to wait. I was less than happy at this point Tesco passing the but for a system that is operated in their store.  Tescos saying to a customer we can help you very poor show. Eventually  I m through to payqwiq the girl takes my name address email address I tell her my problem she says I m very sorry it s a new system when I say I d like to know the out come of my complaint she says Oh no we don t do that we don t contact people we just take the complaint.  What a disgrace Tesco you put in a new system you fail to train your staff on how to rectify problems with it. Your managers haven t a clue to the point they pass the but to an assistant and don t bother to come back and check the problem was resolved. Your customer service passes the butt and says it s not our problem. The company you use couldn t even reassure me it was a safe system to use and had the attitude of well listen to you complaint but we ll do nothing about it. Payqwiq nothing quick about it if I d of stood and payed with penny s it would have been quicker. As for your attitude to customer satisfaction what a disgrace. As for your whole payqwiq system my advice to everyone thinking of installing this app. STEER CLEAR GIVE IT A WIDE BERTH i would raise serious safety issues. I certainly would never use it again. But apart from that very disappointed in what was my main supermarket.

Absolutely shocking service from Tesco Direct!  I have ordered and paid for a double bed frame to be delivered to my house. Received  a text message to say my bed was due for delivery today between 7am and 7pm.  It got to half past 1 this afternoon and I had heard nothing so I rang the number in the text message and spoke to a lady to ask if she could update me as to what time the frame was due to arrive. She then told me that the frame I had ordered had failed its quality control check and was not on its way to me and that in fact a replacement had been chosen for me and they were awaiting my approval. No one had bothered to contact me to tell me this and so it is not going to be Wednesday before my bed arrives! I asked the lady if she could tell me what time roughly it would arrive so I didn t have to waste another day waiting for the doorbell and she told me I would have to ring back after 4pm tomorrow to find out.   As a result of this poor service and sheer lack of communication I am not forced to sleep on my mattress on the floor because I am without a bed frame after selling my previous in time for the new one to arrive.   Will not bother buying anything else from Tesco direct and would like to know how you intend to resolve this complaint.

I would like to commend the staff at the Flitwick Pharmacy store. They have been truly exceptional and amazing to me over the last few weeks of severe illness and incapacitation. Every single member of staff has gone truly above and beyond to help me out. Thank you all enormously  it made a very difficult time for me just that bit easier and to see a happy smiling face every time made my day!

Hi is there still a DTD (double the difference) policy - I was overcharged today.

Hi  I always shop in your store  but recently have found I m having to go to other supermarkets in order to get some of the items I need. My little boy has a cows milk protein allergy  so cannot have any dairy products  and he is also allergic to soya (which is common in CMPA due to the proteins being similar).  Most of the dairy free  yoghurts  you stock contain soya- including all of the tesco own brand ones.  In our local store there are only 2 suitable yoghurts  both made by Coyo (made with coconut milk) and plain or vanilla flavoured.  In the other supermarkets I have managed to get dairy free yoghurts made by  Koko   in the following 4 flavours: raspberry; strawberry; peach and passion fruit; and coconut and lemon. They are much more palatable. Is it likely that you will be getting a wider range of dairy free stock which doesn t also contain soya?  Many thanks for your help.
I think that naming foreign farms with English sounding names is perfectly permissible. There are too many idiots blaming everyone else because they re too lazy to read the small print . . .
I have sent an inbox message but it is in other messages.

You should be ashamed of yourself for using SEVEN?! Fake farm names. Customers DO NOT approve I can tell you. And to the plonker telling Joe they don t sound English and weren t designed to be  Horse poo! They were designed to trick people to think they were made in the fresh green fields of a country farm in Great Britain when they re from South Africa or the Ukraine. There s nothing wrong with buying bananas from South Africa  stop lying to your buyers! Appalling. Avoid this store. Farm shop only where I actually know the source  origin and ingredients  just giving it a fake farm name does nothing.

disagree with what you have said on Countryfile.  Having Willow farm and other similar names IS MISLEADING the public.  I don t think many Chilean apple farms are called Willowbrook!!  Why don t you just have CHILLEAN APPLES on the bag and start being STRAIGHT FORWARD AND HONEST for once  it would make a nice change. It would probably cost you less aswell

Just watched country file and your fake and misleading farm brand names are a disgrace  frankly how dare you it s no wonder customers are leaving you in there thousands  be honest and be fair to your suppliers!

Of course Tesco have deliberately used British sounding farm names for their new branding despite the products coming from abroad....but once again they are happy to blame the consumer for not reading the small print.

Dear Tesco  I will be stopping purchasing anything from your fake  Farm  brands. I do not believe that they clearly represent what they sell. They give the impression of being British by their names and while their origin may be labelled in the small print  I believe that they do not show this clearly enough.
Just seen Countryfile and how Tescos use English fake farms to sell foreign produce under. Cheap shot
SHAME ON YOU TESCO FOR USING 7 FAKE FARM NAMES.

I have thought long and hard whether to write to you about my recent experience in your store on a public forum but if by advising you of this you can educate your staff so that other people in the future do not suffer the same upset then I think it is worth it. On 28/08/2016 I visited your store in Bradley Stoke to purchase a new top for an upcoming social event. Whilst trying this on in the fitting rooms my 8 year old son was sat just outside the door. I enlisted the help of 2 young members of staff for them to give me their opinion on which size looked better on me. Now I am not a small girl  I took a size 14 and 16 into the fitting room. The girls were friendly to my face and between us we decided the larger size fitted better.  Upon leaving the fitting room area with my son he became upset  started to cry  which is unusual for him. When I asked him what was wrong he told me that the girls on the fitting room were making fun of my size  gesturing to the fact that I am overweight and puffing out their cheeks etc whilst sniggering. As a mother I always try to instil in my son that although people come in different shapes and sizes  have different coloured skin and we don’t all look the same for him to be pleasant  nice and friendly to everyone. He couldn’t understand why these two adults could be so cruel. Upon paying for my new clothing the 2 girls had moved onto the till point. My 8 year old son then refused to come to the till with me and waited a little way back as he now viewed these people as “not nice” as they had made fun of his Mum and was a little bit scared of them. They spoke to me and said “oh  you decided to buy it then  it looked nice on you” it was at this point that I questioned them on their actions at the fitting room and told them that I was not happy that they had upset my son. Both understandably denied their actions  but I know that my son would not make this up and cry for no reason in the store. I am disgusted at their behaviour. Sometimes it can take a lot of courage for a larger person to go into a store and select new clothes  as a stockist of clothes up to a size 22 your staff should be more understanding of this. The psychological damage that can take place to a person after an experience like this could take years to recover from  or maybe it would deter people from shopping in store ever again. I am a reasonably strong person but still when I walked through the door at my home I burst into tears. These tears were not only for me but also for my little boy who should not be made to feel the way he was just by an innocent visit to one of your stores. I have the receipt for this purchase which I hope will provide the employee login for you to speak to the staff involved. I would ask that you advise them to be more courteous and understanding to ALL their customers regardless of their size. If by writing to you and you bringing the consequences of their actions to their attention it can save another person from suffering the humiliation that I was made to feel and to not have to explain to their children that some people in the world are not so understanding then this will be worth it.  Sue
