Dear Tesco    Firstly let me set the scene.. We travelled to York to visit a different shop.   Much to our disappointment they were closed when we got there. So never mind  we said we would pop and get some milk and school uniform.  Wandering round the shop  my fiancé pushing the pram  me a trolley  as let s face it  milk and school uniform means we will take half the shop away with us!  Our son decides he is hungry  he s only young  and I ll be honest very spoilt as he s had a rough start to his little life at only 16 months old  5 anaphylactic reactions to date.  Anyway  can you imagine the stares from disapproving people as we are trying to keep him quiet  and him having none of it  shouting for food from the shelf. So we split up  this time me with trolley  so I could look disapprovingly at the fiancé pretending the little boy who is screaming isn t mine (come on if your a parent you have to admit you ve done this before).  Great a multipack of Pom Bears  I grab them  then find the fiancé (which wasn t difficult  I followed the noise!)   So I rip open the packet and give him some...... Silence  and the cute smiling baby was back.  We carried on round the store  staff were helpful  and polite  off we went to pay for our trolley full of shopping  luckily we did scan as you shop so checkout was painless  apart from of course the handing over the money part... That s never easy!  Then the serious part comes  our son  who if you remember has serious allergies  started with blotches appearing on his face  and within seconds his lips were bright red  and he started chocking. This is his anaphylactic symptoms  so we started working our first aid on him  oblivious to anyone or anything around us.  That was until a lady very loudly said   look what she s doing to that child  (he was chocking  so granted he was tilted upside down while I was smacking his back) until then she saw something come out of him onto the floor.... This is where I apologise  we didn t clean it nor inform anyone!   The lady then realised I wasn t beating our son for no reason  and offered help and support... Your staff were oblivious at the time! He then went floppy and unresponsive for only seconds but of course that feels like a lifetime!  My fiancé ran to the car to get his epi pens  my 9 year old daughter followed my instructions to get a bottle of water without paying for it (after a little panic about the security guard sending her to prison) and I gave inhalers and piriton!  After all this we really hadn t noticed anyone around us  and were just doing what we could for our son. We spoke to a member of staff explaining we would go and pay for the water once he was sorted  this member of staff was rude and ignored us  while looking directly at us  never mind... Another member of the team made up for his rudeness  telling us to get anything we needed for our son and nothing was too much trouble  after everything  and by now our son was running around  I went to pay for the water  we were offered a first aider  which we politely declined  obviously he s walking  drinking and eating so fine :)   So I d like to compliment the staff who were kind enough to support and help us  and the customer for stopping to check WE were okay (it shakes you up a little dealing with that)   But most of all I d like an answer to how I spent £54 and forgot the bloody milk???

I ve had nothing but hassle this evening with it and on top of I ve had to drag the kids out at 9pm to get them dinner of which cost I was not expecting. For them to offer £9 is appalling and quite frankly no understanding of how much inconvenience they have cause tonight. Sometimes a sorry just isn t enough when so much disruption is caused to a family and unnecessary costs. I m now having to wait up till 10.30 for my shopping to be delivered...... unacceptable!!!!

Hi Tesco Just wanted to let you that I have wanted to be cross with you twice over the last couple of days but your lovely delivery and customer service team have made that impossible! I ordered 2 Sistema Quad lunchboxes from you on Thursday to be delivered on Friday  1 blue and 1 purple. But with no indication of a substitution on the delivery note  2 blue lunchboxes were delivered. The delivery guy (can t remember his name) checked his system and could see that the purple one had been substituted so he apologised and I sent it back. Once he got back in the van he rang his team to try and get a new one sent out to me. They rang me to apologise again and say that they were out of stock of all but the blue and offered me a different substitute. As you will know if you have more than one child  all has to be fair and the same so I thanked the customer service lady and said no thank you. So I looked round various shops and eventually found a pink Sistema Quad lunchbox in another shop. Brought it home and showed my 2 children their new lunchbox. The 5 year old opened his blue one up and snap! It broke. So I phoned customer services. Close to nervous breakdown about the lunchbox saga and told Emma my tale of woe. After keeping me on hold for 2 minutes she said she would see what she could do and she would call me back. Sure enough  10 minutes later she called to say they were out of stock but were due a delivery tonight. Ordered me a blue lunchbox to be delivered tomorrow and sent me a £5 voucher as a goodwill gesture for all the time it had taken me. And that is how you do customer service Tesco. Well done!

Have just read an article regarding a tesco store near Middlesbrough  which is going to fine parents if they park in parent and child bays who have a child over 4 years old. it seems they also fine shoppers if they park in disabled bays without a blue badge displayed. I have spoken to the soldiers and either get an embarrassed response  but they do not move or I receive abuse from them. I have contacted the store on numerous occasions.  They say they are unable to do anything about it  why?   If one tesco store can take action why can t the Catterick branch.   Smells of apathy to me and an uncaring store.

I am writing this as a post on Facebook  as apparently social media gets more attention than a customer service call centre or a visit to the store in person.  I have been a Tesco shopper since 1991 and I use to enjoy wandering round the Megastore in Bristol near my old house. Since 1999 I moved to Dorset  Dorchester to be precise. We have a very small store  which I had to campaign to get a 500 ream of paper on the shelves for me to buy; as it was an item the couldn t sell in Dorchester? I started taxing in 2001 to support my way through Bournemouth University. As a taxi driver I probably visit Gatwick about 10-15 times a month. In 2009 I discovered a mega store at Gatwick; I was absolutely delighted as it meant I could browse the Megastores again without having to go to far out of my way. I don t go to the store every time as I have a 3hr drive back to work. When I do go sometimes I get there early in the morning and I go and have breakfast then I phone my partner to make sure there hasn t been any urgent bookings; if there has I usually return back to Dorset  if there hasn t I normally spend an hour or two looking at the electronics department  stationary department  Xbox games. Recently in June after I got married we had some money to spend on gifts. I visited the Gatwick store; after I dropped off  to have a study of the smart TVs  as Curry has one on offer for £245. Two and a half to three weeks later I received a £70 parking fine in the post  reduced to £40 if I paid within 14 days.  My favourite megastore for the last seven years has suddenly got a rule that no taxis are allowed to park or wait in the car park! I tried ringing customer service  was told to go to the store in question  visited the Gatwick store  was told by the duty manager I had to go to the horizon parking company that fined me. After appealing with proof of receipts that I have been in the store  and asking why as a customer with no other vehicle to use other than a taxi  how was I supposed to visit the store? That Tesco or Horizon parking have not made provision to be able to apply for an exemptions certificate like I do with my local council to be able to use my local tip. Means I have lost the right to use this store due to horrible persons in the trade that use the store car park as a toilet  and use the parking bays as a waiting area waiting for jobs from their head office s. I think I might be shopping elsewhere from now on  I can t afford £40 every time I want to have a good look at all the products the do! I will especially start boycotting shops using these parking companies to fine third shoppers  2hrs is not enough time. Your the ones making your store like mini mall s! Stop trying to make us rush.

I ordered Jemima Tub Sofa on 02/09/16  the order was confirmed and you took my money. I then received a crappy automated email to say that my order could not be completed on the 03/09/16 and my money would be refunded (5 to 6 working days). No explanation given and very little in the way of an apology. I cannot begin to tell you how upsetting this is and it is a real display of the poor levels of customer service from Tesco. No only am I deeply disappointed that the sofa I wanted was not available (I spent a long time finding this product). If a product is not available you should not take the customer’s money in the 1st place  then to make them wait 6 days to get their money back is shocking. I am now left upset that my sofa is not available and unable to buy an alternative. This really puts me off shopping with Tesco and I am not sure I would even buy my groceries from you.

My mum is registered disabled and tried to get a disabled space at ure Irvine store the other day - none to be had so i got out the car and looked at each of the cars. 8 cars had no disability badge displayed and therefore should not have been parked there. I asked customer service if there was anything that could be done and she told me  no its not a tesco carpark so we cant do anything  - but hold on a minute.... my dad parked in a parent child space not so long ago and his car registration plate was read over the tanoid to go to customer services. When he got there he was verbally forced to move his car to another space. So why wasnt the same done for my mums needs when she has mobility problems and needed a space close to the store instead of being like i said away at the back of beyond of the car park. Surely its not one rule for one and one rule for another Tesco.   Can someone please clarify for me please

I took out tesco pet insurance as I was excited about the offer of £40 in tesco points  So I added in my tesco card number as requested on the site  & was happy to have my new pet insurance no RSAP3175538200  My name Mrs Lynn Doherty  This was a few months ago I phoned them today & said I hadn t received my £40 voucher which I confused with the £40 points I was left waiting on the phone & told by the young boy on the phone that there had never been a scheme  like that he d even phoned head office to be told nothing even similar so I got off the phone I am disabled & sometimes get confused but I went online to find it was £40 in points so I phoned back where the customer services person flipitantly said yes you phoned earlier about £40 in vouchers but it was points if they knew that why not explain that on the phone ??? So I said can I have my points to b told no the offer is gone I said I I had put my card number in he said yes but u never put the code I never got promoted that on the computer only to put my customer card in & told online all customer card holders would get the points he said I can see you did this but i can t help me I asked to speak to a manager / supervisor was told they would say the same  & was told I couldn t speak to one   u can t just speak to a manager not here   and that  I would have to put this in as a complaint I m extremely  upset I would appreciate a prompt reply  Thank you

Shockingly bad customer service from the great Yarmouth branch today funnily enough not from the actual staff member on the customer service desk who was dealing with us but from other staff members putting their point of view about Tesco customers across. Our visit today started as most normal visits do with our 7 year old going to look at the PS3 controllers all summer holidays he has been doing little jobs for money to buy himself a new one(he had to buy his own as he only wanted a new one because it looked cool!) and every time he makes sure you still have the £19 pdp afterglow wireless ones! Today he finally had £19 so looked at them and chose the one that glows blue(the choice was blue or red) we pay but are charged £20 he gets a little worried as he only has £19 but we tell him it s ok we will go to costumer services to get them to check the price the lady happily hose to check the item and the price comes back and says that the product didn t match the item barcode for the price but she offered to take us to the technology desk to see if they had any £19 ones left  hubby our son go with her whilst I go to see if paying the £1 extra might mean a better controller. I am looking at all the PS3 controllers and not one is priced at £20 as I m looking another member of staff asks if I m the one complaining that the controller is in the wrong place? I say not complaining just wanting to see the difference she then shows me an xbox360 controller I say we don t want an Xbox but a PS3 controller for her to say you picked £20 one not £19 customers are always moving things and blaming us I try to explain that I m not blaming anyone and I would like her to show me the £20 ones so I can compare them to the £19 ones as I m talking my husband the first customer services lady and another staff member join us the member of staff I m talking with and the new member of staff start complaining about customers moving things and then complaining they are being over charged again I ask to be shown the £20 ones again I was shown an Xbox controller first customer service lady says no where are these controllers(she has the one we had picked in her hand) for the other staff members to say they have no idea they must have been controllers that had been returned and have been put out with the £19 ones as they have no price tag for them only Xbox ones and we should have looked at the barcode numbers on item and the price ticket before we payed when I asked how I would know the price I got told you would know when you payed it s only a pound so what s the fuss? The only difference was the colour the controller glowed(red was £19 blue was £20) so I ask if we could be refunded for the blue and get the red(why pay just for a different colour?)First Lady say yes other ladies take the £20 ones and put them back with the £19 ones when I say don t you think you should move them or price them up properly they said no as they wouldn t have the price code anymore for just two items and if anyone complained they would just say customers have moved them!

I would just like to thank the staff member at Tesco abbeymeads in Swindon for posting the cards I left in store which o was going to post really brings back my faith in people your doing a great job so thank you for doing that :)

3rd time I ve been shopping at Tesco (Western Avenue  Cardiff) with my baby. Every time the only parent and children parking spaces available are in front of Costa which is no problem. The problem is that every time there is only 1 trolley with the shelf for the infant car seat. And this trolley is filthy. The handle is covered in greyish black sticky stuff which is revolting  especially as you touch the trolley and then groceries or your baby.  I was just stop going to Tesco (at least until my daughter is old enough to sit in a normal trolley - I wouldn t put my daughter in the blue hard seats for babies as she is in a harness for hip problems). Then your employee Philip ( I think he is a  trolley manager ) approached me when I left the shop and offered to help me with putting my shopping in the boot  opening the doors so I could put the car seat in easier and return the trolley for me. I never experienced such helpful behaviour in a supermarket before. I just wish you would sort out the trolley situation.

Really upset with the clothing staff at the Wath branch. My elderly mum went in to the changing rooms today to try a few items on as its her birthday  she suffers with various health problems so her mobility and breathing aren t the best. At one point she realised she needed some help so pressed the buzzer but ended up slipping and banging her head. No one came so she managed to open the door to see the staff members too busy singing and dancing. She eventually managed to get herself up and once out she told them she had pressed the button but was advised it s not even working! She could have seriously hurt herself and no one would have even noticed! They didn t seem to care about what had happened either. Really disappointed and so is she. It s put a downer on her birthday now :(

I love that we live in a world with such amazing technology for communication. It s a day and age where we never have to let people wonder what is happening or where we are. We have everything from good old phone calls to text  email  FaceTime  Skype  Facebook and Twitter.  Yet I am amazed that tesco seem to be unable to effectively use any of these forms of communication. I am wondering why I was sat up till midnight last night waiting for a food order that should have arrived between 10-11pm but never came. I waited till midnight on the chance that my driver was delayed and that he would be doing his best to get to me  that if my food was not coming someone would have had to good grace to have used one of these forms of communication to tell me.  Today I picked up the phone (that classic form of communication) to find out what happened. Apparently an accident MUCH earlier in the day had meant the driver didn t have time to complete his orders. Again this is where I am confused  an accident much earlier in the day meaning they had plenty of notice to grab one of those forms of communication and stop me sitting up till midnight waiting. But no call  no text  no email!  So disappointed in the awful customer service and I am amazed at the lack of consideration to your customers.

Every time I pop to your store on aylsham road in Norwich it s pretty busy. The staff deal with this and never have I seen anyone be thrown out for putting their items on a till. Today a lovely black gent and his lady were in your store. As the till wasn t free because someone was being served he put his items on the till next to it. No issue. Seen it many  many times. However your staff member seemed to take great offence to this and looked the chap up and down before raising his voice rudely telling him to  back off.  Trés professional. The customer simply said  please don t be rude to me. I ve done nothing wrong.  Security was called and the couple were asked to leave. Now  I d usually just assume that the staff member in question was just an idiot  but I ve seen the same guy deal with problem customers and druggies with more respect and courtesy. A few minutes before this another black chap was having an issue on self service and the way the same staff member spoke to him was simply disgusting. I go into this store on almost a daily basis and while I ve made many comments to my partner about this staff member being rude  this was way too far and I believe it was a personal issue the staff member has. Maybe an  are you a horrendous racist?  Test should be taken before hiring in your stores?

Never ever will I purchase anything electrical again from tesco . I purchased a tablet for my daughter in October last year . The tablet I purchased has now stopped charging. We have the receipt as proof of purchase and the receipt clearly states on the receipt that there is a guarantee for 1 year. We have been down to tesco to get this sorted to be told as after 30 days we have to go direct to asus. I was not happy about this as we go the tablet from you. If I d have bought it from anywhere else I would have taken it back to them why are you so different just because it s not one of your products? I have now wasted time and money ringing asus direct and my daughter is still without her tablet! We have been asked by asus for the serial number which we do not have( it s only on the box apparently which we kept for 3 months and then threw it) it s not on the receipt nor the tablet itself . They don t seem to believe us and so said they will send us an email so we can take a picture of our receipt and send it back before they will send out something in the post to get the tablet for a repair?! They also cannot speak English very well which is causing another issue ( don t mean to be rude but it s a fact) I have been waiting for this email to come and have had nothing so have just called them yet again to be told they don t send emails!!!!? The person we spoke to today tried fobbing us off yet again saying we need serial number we asked to speak to someone in authority and was told we have to email? ( they had just said don t do emails) all I want is for this to be resolved and for my daughter to have a working tablet especially as she s going back to school on Monday! I am very annoyed at tesco lack of customer service here as we purchased it from you and I feel you should be dealing with this regardless of who the tablet was made by! We have a useless product and are still no where near resolving this nearly 2 weeks on!

Tesco  I m looking for some advice  today I was in a bit of a problem with a fellow customer in the car park at the Clifton moor store.   I parked not close to the store but not miles away with nothing either side of me when I parked up. This is because I m 8 months pregnant and the size of a small whale and my mother who was with me has just four weeks ago had a full knee replacement and is on crutches and struggles getting in and out of the car   my problem is that I m not a mother and baby yet and she s not classed as disabled so we can t park in spaces that are wider.   When I got back to my car someone had parked next to me  which of course they are entitled to do but hadn t left much room at my side to get in the car. We actually saw him park and get out of his car as we walking up to my car and I complained that we had done so well not to have anyone park near us till just then.  Anyway unpacked the trolley and put them away while mum was getting in. In that short time the man had come back to his car and was sat inside. I went to squeeze in with my ginormous belly and my car door just touched his wing mirror  there was no mark at all on his car I literally just touched it and grabbed the door and pulled it to me. I then waved and said sorry through his window to which he got out of his car and came round to check his wing mirror and my car. Proceeded to shout through my car window  which won t actually go down as its broken. And tell me that it s a good job I ve only damaged my own car. I no my cars scratched and bang from myself banging it on my house wall in the wind! So I opened my door and said to him well that s alright then! And he shouted about it would have cost me money and I should be more careful.   And very aggressively got back in his car slammed the door and drove off.  Now him I just find rude and arrogant. I didn t mean to touch his car  he hadn t left space and I did apologise I really didn t even make any sort of mark at all on mine or his car. But in the future what am I supposed to do ? Park a million miles away with my waddle and mum on crutches? Park in a space not designated to us at risk of been penalised for that or have arguments in car parks sighs very rude men?

Despicable customer service... Purchased a beard trimmer on the 01/01/2016 @ 17.56 I have the receipt which advises   Tesco Guarantees all its electrical products for 1 year. If your product develops a fault  please return it to store along with proof of purchase and all accessories for an exchange or refund   I have moved from the area from which I got the trimmer from and went down to my local express store. They advise me that the policy has changed within the last month and they no longer are allowed to do refunds on products they don t have in that particular store. Unfortunately tesco s at the time of the purchase you had the policy in place that I could take it into any store and so therfore you should adhere to that policy that you had in force when I purchased the product.  Under the Consumer Rights Act 2015  goods should be of a satisfactory quality  fit for purpose and as described. My rights have been breached because the item you sold me is faulty.  Phoned customer service up and they have advised that I must go to a bigger store. I have asked them if they will refund the cost of getting a taxi there and back. They are unable to advise me if they can or not. They have advised that I post the product back to head office again unable to advise if they will be able to cover expenses for this.  Manager would not speak to me  he is too busy apparently   Through no fault of my own I have been sold a faulty electrical product and tesco is making it very difficult for me to come to any resolution. I am seeking currently seeking legal advice.

Could you please advise me who we contact regarding a potential fatal product you stock?  My daughter is breastfeeding her 4 week old baby. And up til today has been using boots own breast pads with no issues.  However we picked up some of your own brand breast pads yesterday while in your cleethorpes store. She began using them today. Not only does she need to change them pretty much hourly as they are so rubbish. But after rushing to feed her baby  baby started choking. We very quickly held her up and she was sick. Then realised that all around babies mouth and my daughters breast was the inside contents of the breast pad.  As already stated. The breast pads are changed almost hourly due to their poor absorbance. So for them to split and become so hazardous so soon is shocking.

Dear Tesco    On bank holiday Monday 30th August I was travelling back from Gloucester to West Sussex  taking the scenic Cotswold route in the setting sun. An hour into my journey I began to tire and pulled over to change my contact lenses for spectacles. Digging into my wash bag for the lens case I managed to slice my thumb on the three bladed razor that I d obviously forgotten to cap safely - blood began pouring everywhere and of course the first aid kit had gone to scout camp with my son and not yet been returned. I saw a Tesco up ahead and even though it was almost 4pm (closing time) I asked if I might be allowed to purchase a box of plasters.   I was taken into the store to the customer service desk  handed a tissue  asked how the injury occurred  received treatment with an alcohol sterilising wipe followed by a plaster and shown to the toilets so I could clean up my arm and change my contacts. I was then offered help in cleaning the blood from the car interior.   This was after closing time on a bank holiday shift; they could ve denied me entry to the store or made me buy plasters for myself  but instead they took me in and tended gently to my wound without a second thought. At no time was I made to feel a nuisance or rushed. I even said you don t have to do all this - to which they replied that they knew they didn t have to  but they wanted to.   This happened at Tesco in Farringdon on Monday 30th Aug 2016 and the man on the door was called Gary  the man at customer services was called Trevor and there was another young man at customer services whose name I didn t get.   Please arrange for these three exceptional members of staff to be rewarded for their wonderful customer service.

Your .com website is yet again experiencing what has now become a frequently recurring problem  of some multi-buy offers not being properly recognised and the offer price calculated when the items are added to a basket  making keeping track of the running total of your shop at any given time  difficult at best. For example  1.75L bottles of Classic Coke are included in a Any 2 for £2.00 offer which commenced on 31/08  which  when added to a basket in odd number quantities  which obviously don t qualify for the offer  the basket advises you have not qualified for the offer  but when you add them in even number quantities  the basket charges the full non-offer price  and makes no mention of any offer. Similarly  Andrex Toilet Tissue 9 Roll Aloe Vera are included in a 3 for £10.00 or 2 for £7.50 offer which also commenced on 31/08. However in their case  regrdless of how many packs are added to a basket  all are charged at the full price and no mention of the offer is ever made in any way.
